title: Academic Writing
description:
This course is a writing seminar designed to help students learn to prepare for and write a masterâ€™s thesis AND to become better academic writers overall.  Academic writing can be a new form of writing for many students and they need assistance in order to successfully express their ideas in academic settings.
This course will emphasize a variety of topics including how to write a research question, how to write a problem statement and rationale for a study, how to craft a purpose for the study, how to conduct, synthesize, and write a review of the literature, how to use APA formatting appropriately to improve academic writing skills.

title: Academic Writing
description: Learning how to write essays, reports, and research papers acceptable in an American university

title: Academic Internship
description: Combined study-work experience related to classical studies majors (museums, libraries, international universities and centers, publishers, etc.).

title: Accelerated Street Dance
description: Studio course facilitating accelerated skills, freestyle movement, and surveying of various street dance and hip hop traditions including breaking, poppin, lockin, and party dances. These skills will be addressed mainly through physical practice in class and includes readings, viewings, listening, and an off-campus community event to understand the cultural context of hip hop dance. Classes will perform tasks and battle in each evaluation, as well as in the final exam.

title: Accelerated Street Dance
description: Studio course facilitating accelerated skills, freestyle movement, and surveying of various street dance and hip hop traditions including breaking, poppin, lockin, and party dances. These skills will be addressed mainly through physical practice in class and includes readings, viewings, listening, and an off-campus community event to understand the cultural context of hip hop dance. Classes will perform tasks and battle in each evaluation, as well as in the final exam.\n

title: Account Planning Mgmt
description: Development and execution of comprehensive strategic advertising qualitative research, including data collecting, interpretation, field investigating, audience analysis, and strategy development.

title: Accounting for Lawyers
description: This course teaches generally accepted accounting principles, practices, and standards. Includes information about accrual accounting and revenue recognition, double-entry record keeping, development of accounting principles and auditing standards, the time value of money, financial statement analysis, and contingencies. Intended for law students who do not have an accounting background. Students who have a substantial background in accounting or who have recently taken an introductory accounting class are ineligible to take or receive credit for this course.

title: Accounting Research Seminar
description: Professional standards and professional literature of accounting and auditing; related academic research.  Research tools, information technologies, and critical analysis emphasized.

title: Accounting Technology Hub
description: Develop and post technology challenges on TechHub.training, focusing on essential accounting tools such as Excel, Alteryx, and Tableau. Engage in peer mentoring, enhance technical writing, communication skills, and website design for a global audience.

title: Acoustical Measurement Methods
description: Acoustics-based data acquisition and signal processing in the time and frequency-domain domains. Use of acoustical measurement standards. Preparation of technical memoranda.

title: ACT Math
description: Not a valid course. Only to be used to apply credits to General Education requirements.

title: Acting 1: BFA or Pre-BFA
description: Accelerated fundamental acting skills:  exercises in perception, objective/action, thought processes, scoring of scripts.  Lab required.

title: Acting 2
description: Integrating acting skills; building a character through exercises and scene work.

title: Acting Capstone
description: Participation in a final acting project on the BYU main-stage season.

title: Acting Classics
description: Acting skills helpful in classical literature, emphasizing Shakespearean scansion and text analysis.

title: Acting Explorations
description: Exploration into various Western acting techniques, styles, and practices to provide further acting experiences as part of a liberal arts education.

title: Acting for Film & TV
description: On-camera techniques for features, sitcoms, industrials, and commercials.

title: Acting Fundamentals
description: Fundamental acting skills: exercises in perception, objective/action, thought processes, scoring of scripts. Lab required.

title: Acting Improvisation
description: Discovery of emotion, thought process, and impulse through improvisation.

title: Acting Pedagogy
description: Students will become perceptive, inquisitive, practical theatre artists and educators by researching, performing, and teaching diverse acting pedagogies.\n

title: Acting Practicum

title: Action Research Project
description: Developing, observing, gathering, interpreting, and reporting data from action research project. Two project credit hours must be taken during semester of project defense.

title: Act/Pass Filter

title: Actuarial Problems
description: Applying mathematical statistics in actuarial science. Prepares for SOA Exam P.

title: Adapted/Multicultural PE Tchrs
description: Legal mandates, assessing and identifying special needs students, multicultural issues, and management and instructional techniques.

title: Adaptive Team Leadership
description: Adaptive leadership skills; demands of leadership in tactical and garrison situations. Cadets have multiple opportunities to lead one another and receive feedback on leadership abilities.  Lab included.

title: Addiction Recovery Healing
description: Addiction, recovery, and healing are examined in marriage and family context; beginning preparation for relationship-oriented addiction recovery counseling careers.

title: Addictions&Violenc
description: Assessment and treatment of multiple-problem family systems, emphasizing addictions and abuse.

title: Admin ECE Program
description: Strategies for planning and administering quality programs in settings for young children. Budgeting, staffing, accrediting, selecting equipment, etc.

title: Adm of Athletic Training Prog
description: Management and administration of athletic training facilities and staff members.

title: Administrative Law
description: An examination of the administrative process.  The course examines why administrative agencies are created, how they obtain information and the uses of that information, what proceedings (rulemaking/adjudication) agencies can commence, and what controls over agency action (political/judicial) exist.  The role of the attorney in this process is emphasized.

title: Ad Dev & Class Mgmt
description: Analysis of education practice and the relationship between theories and research on development, classroom management, education and the practice of teaching. Focus on adolescent development and an introduction to classroom management.

title: Adolescent Development
description: Adolescent development in the context of education.  Focus is on the implications for integrated school culture, curriculum design, instructional practices, and assessment.

title: Adol Dev Fam & Soc
description: Examining developmental and social contexts of adolescents, emphasizing the importance of the family. Other contexts include peers, religion, community, schools, and cross-cultural issues.

title: Adolescent Dev in Fam & Soc
description: Examining the developmental and social contexts of adolescents with emphasis on the importance of the family. Other contexts include peers, religion, community, schools, and cross-cultural issues.

title: Adult Applied Technology Prgms
description: Identifying, developing, and implementing relevant applied technology training programs.

title: Adult Development & Aging
description: Adjustments to physical, emotional, social, and economic changes. Needs arising from changes in family relationships, living arrangements, and employment; retirement planning.

title: Adult Neuropsychology
description: Overview of basic concepts and methods in the neuropsychological assessment of adult populations, including recognizing quantitative and qualitative aspects of test performance and behaviors most relevant to diagnosis.

title: Adv. 3D Modeling
description: Focus on improving Solidworks and Keyshot software proficiency by understanding software terms, practicing modeling techniques, combining solid modeling with surface modeling, evaluating design intent, and designing for assembly.

title: Adv Academic English
description: Integrated skills course for nonnative English speakers, primarily focused on academic listening, speaking, and the basic skills needed for success at an American university.

title: Advanced Academic Internship
description: Work experience evaluated by supervisor and posted on student's transcript.

description: Apply an analytic mindset to problems. Learn advanced data analytic tools and techniques including extracting, transforming, and loading data; querying databases; visualizing data; and applying statistical concepts in accounting settings.

title: Adv Acc Analytics-Tax
description: Apply an analytic mindset to problems. Learn advanced data analytic tools and techniques including extracting, transforming, and loading data; querying databases; visualizing data; and applying statistical concepts in accounting settings.

title: Advanced Acting

title: Adv Advertising Concept 3

title: Adv Algorithms & Probl Solving
description: This course will help students to become better at problem solving, increasing their ability to excel at technical/coding interviews (a challenging part of the hiring/interviewing process).  Students will build on the algorithms and problem-solving strategies that they were taught and had limited practice with in CS 312. learning primarily through targeted practice.  This will result in (1) strengthened skills in each style of problem-solving strategy and (2) the ability to quickly decide which strategy(ies) to apply to a given problem.  Students are expected to spend 6+ hours outside of class each week solving interview-type problems.

title: Advanced ASL
description: Fifth in a series of five courses, which aims to increase interpersonal, receptive, and presentational ASL skills at the advanced level in the context of society and culture of the Deaf community.

title: Adv Appellate Adv
description: Written and oral advocacy in the appellate process, including strategy, persuasion techniques, circuit splits, policy argument, standards of review, adverse authority, and counterargument.

title: Adv Career Counsel
description: Survey of current research in career psychology. Advanced career counseling techniques focusing on the interface between career and personal issues and the use of assessment.

title: Advanced Cellular Neuroscience
description: Graduate-level principles and contemporary developments in neural science. Structure-function relationships and integration of biophysical, molecular, and/or cellular neuroscience.

title: Adv Charac Anim

title: Advanced Clinical Nutrition
description: Theory, techniques, and practices in medical nutrition therapy.

title: Adv Clinical Specializatn-MFT

title: Adv Compara Law 2
description: Papers written on transnational and comparative topics during fall prepared for possible inclusion in law review.

title: Advanced Composition
description: Private lessons in music composition.

title: Advanced Computer Graphics
description: Advanced computer graphics systems programming and architecture, including ray tracing, radiosity, animation, and physically based modeling.

title: Adv Computer Networks
description: Computer networking, software architecture, organization, protocols, routing, global networks, local networks, internet standards, and applications.

title: Adv Comp Security
description: Authentication and authorization using digital credentials.

title: Adv Computer-Aided Prog
description: CAD/CAM programming techniques and requirements for manufacturing components on computer numerical-control machine tools, emphasizing CAM programming, postprocessors, and CAM software evaluation.

title: Adv Compu-Assistd Translation
description: Advanced exploration of how computer-assisted translation technology is used to solve problems concerning translation quality, speed, and freedom of content.

title: Advanced Conversation
description: Emphasizes conversation in everyday situations. Students role play various situations in class and then apply their learning in Jerusalem.

title: Advanced Conversation
description: Emphasis on sophisication of speech.

title: Advanced Conversation
description: Building vocabulary and developing skills needed to exceed assessed proficiency rating.

title: Advanced Conversation
description: Building vocabulary and developing skills needed to exceed assessed proficiency rating.

title: Advanced Conversation
description: Advanced conversation skill across a variety of topics with a focus on improving language production.

title: Advanced Corporate Finance
description: Analyzing the economic incentive and understanding the risks/benefits of transactions such as mergers/acquisitions, changing value drivers, leveraged buyouts, changing capital structure, international investing, tax-driven restructurings, leasing, recapitalizations, and industry restructurings.

title: Adv Corporate Financial Rprtng
description: Areas of financial reporting where managers have considerable discretion, including pensions, leases, equity securities, earnings, dilution, employee stock options, and deferred taxes.  Dynamics between auditors, managers, and financial analysts.

title: Adv Dance Tech Workshop
description: Studies in advanced ballet or contemporary dance technique in a workshop environment. Teacher approval required.

title: Advanced Data Communications
description: Design, management, and strategic use of local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), intranets, and the Internet to solve business problems.

title: Advanced Deep Learning
description: In-depth examination of the mathematical foundations of modern deep learning, surveying current research in the area. Topics include stochastic and distributed optimization, regularization, initialization, network architecture design, and loss function design. Concepts are developed in the context of various application areas including supervised learning, generative modeling, and reinforcement learning.

title: Advanced Design
description: Advanced techniques in performance design.

title: Adv Design: Lighting
description: Advanced techniques in performance design for lighting.

title: Adv Design: Makeup
description: Advanced techniques in performance design for makeup.

title: Adv Design: Costumes
description: Advanced techniques in performance design for costumes.

title: Adv Design: Scenic
description: Advanced techniques in performance design for scenic.

title: Adv Design: Sound
description: Advanced techniques in performance design for sound.

title: Adv Developmental Psych
description: Major research in developmental psychology, emphasizing theory, content, and methodology.

title: Adv Dietetics Prac
description: Skill development in specialized topics of medical nutrition therapy and administrative dietetics.

title: Adv Digital & Wireless Comm
description: Linear and nonlinear M-ary modulation and detection, system performance in AWGN and multipath fading environments, equalization, synchronization, spread spectrum.

title: Advanced Digital Marketing
description: Builds on digital marketing skills to give students deeper understanding and abilities to conduct search engine optimization, paid search marketing, display advertising, and more.

title: Adv Digital Systems
description: Advanced synchronous systems design; CAD and HDLs; high-speed, low-power digital circuit architectures.

title: Advanced Directing
description: Theories and techniques of directing for the stage through directing projects for public presentation.

title: Adv. E-Learning Dev
description: Team-based development of an instructional product for a local client.

title: Adv Earth Data Visualization
description: Analyzing data to create a variety of student-selected geological illustrations emphasizing maps and cross-sections.

title: Advanced Econometrics
description: Theory and practice of formulating, estimating, and analyzing economic models.

title: Advanced EMS Internship
description: Internship for advanced students in the on-campus emergency medical services (EMS) program.

title: Adv English Pronunciation
description: Improving the speaking ability of nonnative English students, emphasizing rhetorical and communication strategies, pronunciation, stress, rhythm, intonation, and fluency.

title: Adv Estate Planng
description: An examination of the effective disposition of wealth by inter vivos gift and testamentary transfer; income, estate, and gift tax considerations; use of trust form; use of insurance; use of jointly held property; planning for continuation or disposition of client's business interests.

title: Adv Exerc Phy Cardiopulmonary
description: Cardiovascular and pulmonary physiology, assessments, responses to exercise, and interventions.

title: Adv Ex Phys: Skeletal Muscle
description: Effects of acute and chronic exercise on anatomy, physiology, and biochemistry of skeletal muscle.

title: Adv Experimental Design
description: Response surface methods, mixture designs, and optimal designs; fractions of two-level, three-level, and mixed-level factorials; analysis of experiments with complex aliasing; robust parameter designs.

title: Advanced Family Finance
description: Time value of money principles applied to family finance.

title: Advanced Family Processes
description: Applying evidence-based best practices, processes, and principles in developing personal wellbeing and family strengths. May include communication, reconciliation, ritualization, conflict resolution, honoring agency, trauma, distance regulation, forgiveness, gratitude, physiology and relationships, healthy religious processes

title: AdvFilmProd-Fict:Prepro.
description: Collaborative writing and directing a fiction advanced film production.

title: AdvFilmProd-Fict:Prod. & Post
description: Collaborative directing and editing a fiction advanced film production.

title: AdvFilmProd-NonFict:Post
description: Collaborative developing, directing, shooting and editing advanced student non-fiction projects.

title: AdvFilmProd-NonFict:Pre
description: Non-Fiction Advanced Film Productions (AFPs) are peer-mentoring environments provided by the Media Arts Department and initiated by Media Arts majors. While the student initiating a Non-Fiction AFP assumes the primary responsibility for interacting with the Department, the process is collaborative. These advanced projects are generally culminating experiences at the end of a student's undergraduate work (similar to a senior project). Each Non-Fiction AFP comes with associated coursework, class credit, and departmental supervision. Non-Fiction AFPs also receive a large amount of departmental support, through equipment access and funding.  This class covers Pre-Production.

title: AdvFilmProd-NonFict:Prod
description: Non-Fiction Advanced Film Productions (AFPs) are peer-mentoring environments provided by the Media Arts Department and initiated by Media Arts majors. While the student initiating a Non-Fiction AFP assumes the primary responsibility for interacting with the Department, the process is collaborative. These advanced projects are generally culminating experiences at the end of a student's undergraduate work (similar to a senior project). Each Non-Fiction AFP comes with associated coursework, class credit, and departmental supervision. Non-Fiction AFPs also receive a large amount of departmental support, through equipment access and funding.  This class covers Pre-Production.

title: Adv Financial Accounting
description: Advanced financial accounting topics including pensions, earnings per share, accounting changes, and deferred income taxes.

title: Adv. Fin. & Strat. Analysis
description: Exploring skills used in corporate finance, consulting, and investment banking, including: financial statement analysis, firm valuation, industry analysis, mergers and acquisitions, cross border valuation and analysis, and analysis of security characteristics in capital raises.

title: Adv Financial Management
description: Capital budgeting, cost of capital, capital structure/dividends, mergers and acquisitions, and current financial problems.

title: Adv Financial Statemnt Auditng
description: Accounting methodology, professional auditing standards, and current issues.

title: Adv First Aid & Safety
description: In-depth coverage of first aid procedures for injuries and sudden illness. Leads to first aid and CPR certifications.

title: Advanced Fluid Acoustics
description: General solutions of the wave equation with applications. Kirchhoff-Helmholtz integral theorem. Sound radiation from generalized sources. Attenuation of propagating waves. Acoustic reflection, absorption, and scattering. Enclosed sound fields. Room acoustics. Energy-based acoustics.

title: Advanced Food Preparation
description: Lecture, readings, and intense practicum in food preparation, food preservation and storage, presentation, consumerism, equipment usage, and social/familial aspects of food. Lab required.

title: Adv Formal Arabic Conversation
description: Advanced conversation and rhetorical skills based on point/counterpoint debates.

title: Advanced Francophone Culture
description: Advanced study of Francophone culture requiring significant research paper. Taken as part of a program abroad.

title: Advanced French Part 1
description: Grammar and composition, listening and speaking skills.

title: Advanced French Part 2
description: Grammar and composition, listening and speaking skills.

title: Advanced Genetic Analysis
description: Close examination of core genetic principles as presented in both classic and current literature with the goal of understanding current uses of genetics to examine gene function. Emphasis given to the experimental basis of transmission genetics (transfer of information between generations) as presented in classic studies and contemporary uses of genetic analysis to define gene function in current literature.

title: Advanced GIS
description: Performing geographic tasks in resource management decision support and scientific research using spatial data management and analysis tools and techniques.

title: Adv Hlth Assessment
description: Development of physical assessment techniques across the life span.

title: Advanced Human Nutrition 1
description: Nutritional status and scientific basis for dietary recommendations for carbohydrates, lipids, protein, and energy.

title: Advanced Human Nutrition 2
description: Nutritional status and scientific basis for dietary recommendations for vitamins, minerals, and water.

title: Adv Human-Computer Interaction
description: Advanced techniques for designing, prototyping, building, and evaluating technology-mediated user experiences. Human-computer interaction research methods including experimental design. Ethics of working with human subjects. HCI theories and best practices.

title: Adv. Hydraulic Routing
description: Study of the equations of motion governing unsteady, two-dimensional water flow in open channels; computer solutions of the equations.

title: Advanced Hydrogeology
description: Equations governing fluid flow through saturated porous media under various geologic conditions; applying hydraulic characteristics to analysis of well and aquifer conditions.

title: Advanced Immunology
description: Exploring current topics in immunology through critical reading of primary literature; presentations, group discussions, and analytical writing about specific areas within the discipline.

title: Advanced Impact Investing
description: Advanced focus of impact investing due diligence and analysis methods. Practical application of these skills on current impact investment opportunities.\n\n

title: Adv Individual Tax
description: Advanced topics related to issues associated with higher income individual taxpayers.

title: Advanced Inorganic Laboratory
description: Synthesis, characterization, and properties of materials; coordination and organometallic compounds.

title: Adv Instrc Design
description: Advanced laboratory in instructional system design, production, formative evaluation, packaging, and implementation. Systematic critical analysis of all phases of development.

title: Adv Internal Combustion Engine
description: Detailed combustion analysis of compression and spark ignition engines. Modeling concepts from zero to multidimensional. Engine heat transfer and I.C. engine diagnostics.

title: Adv Issues in Human Dev
description: Evaluation of research on physical, mental, emotional, and social development.

title: Advanced 1: Current Events
description: Using Japanese to describe and formulate opinions about current events reported in Japanese media.

title: Advanced Japanese: Modern Lit
description: Readings in modern short fiction, emphasizing grammar, reading comprehension, vocabulary building, and stylistic analysis.

title: Advanced KCACTF
description: Coaching advanced students who will participate in the Kennedy Center American College Theatre Festival.

title: Advanced Landscape Design
description: Design and composition as applied to development of commercial and institutional property grounds

title: Advanced Legal Internship
description: Legal research; courtroom observation; client and attorney interaction; and reflection exercises.

title: Adv Legal Research
description: Advanced legal research sources and methodologies.

title: Adv. Life Drawing
description: Drawing the draped human figure in modern or historical costume.

title: Adv. Life Drawing
description: Drawing the human figure through gesture and observation.

title: Adv Lifestyle & Chr Dis Prev
description: Managing health risks, particularly those relating to cardiovascular disease, cancer, and obesity.

title: Advanced Linear Algebra
description: Theory and advanced topics of linear algebra.

title: Advanced Logic and Metalogic
description: Completeness, soundness, and undecidability of first-order logic; incompleteness of arithmetic; treatment of related philosophical topics and of nonclassical topics as time permits.

title: Adv Long-term Act Math
description: Advanced modeling of long term contingent risks including the basics of survival analysis, multistate survival models, and multiple decrement survival models. Prepares for SOA Exam ALTAM.

title: Advanced Machine Learning
description: Understand the fundamental models of machine learning, such as neural networks, decision trees, data mining, clustering, Bayesian learning, ensembles, reinforcement learning, and deep learning. Work with data and machine learning tools in real world applications.

title: Adv Machine Learning Models
description: Advanced models, algorithms, and approaches in neural networks and machine learning.

title: Adv Macroeconomics
description: Theory of determining national income, employment, inflation, and interest rates. Issues of economic fluctuations, economic growth, and monetary and fiscal policy.

title: Adv Management Accounting
description: Advanced concepts, including the role of accounting in strategic and operational decision-making.

title: Adv Management in Dietetics
description: Theory and application of management principles in dietetics.

title: Advanced Marketing Analytics A
description: An immersive experience in marketing data and analytics.  Students work on analytics projects for a variety of companies focusing on developing data products.

title: Advanced Marketing Analytics B
description: An immersive experience in marketing data and analytics.  Students work on analytics projects for a variety of companies focusing on developing data products.

title: Adv Materials Development
description: Principles and procedures for designing, developing, and evaluating professional-quality language teaching/learning materials for various types: textbooks, software, audiovisual aids, etc.

title: Advanced Math/Foreign Language
description: Not a valid course. Only to be used to apply credits to General Education requirements.

title: Adv Media Arts Production
description: Principles and techniques of advanced media production, information gathering, conceptualizing and storytelling for broadcast production.

title: Advanced Mentored Research
description: Advanced mentored research in microbiology and molecular biology topics.

title: Advanced Methods
description: Coverage of a variety of advanced and specific topics in Psychological research and analysis. Course content will vary by instructor.

title: Advanced Micro Theory 1
description: Household optimization, firm optimization, equilibrium with competitive markets, and economy-wide welfare analysis.

title: Advanced Micro Theory 2
description: Game theory tools, used in the study of strategic interaction and imperfect information in current economic research.

title: Advanced Mineralogy
description: Crystallography, structure, and crystal chemistry of major silicate mineral groups.

title: Advanced Model Checking
description: Techniques for managing state explosion and specialized algorithms for verifying classes of infinite state systems.

title: Adv Modern Standard Arabic
description: Advanced work in reading, writing, listening, speaking.

title: Adv Molecular Biology
description: Molecular biology of gene structure and expression in prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms.

title: Adv Molecular Biology Lab
description: Laboratory to accompany MMBio 441.

title: Advanced Morphology
description: Morphological theory and applications including the lexicon, inflectional and derivational processes, compounding, valency, lexical conceptual and argument structure, morphophonology and morphosyntax, learnability, and modeling.

title: Adv Musskl Hum Anat (incl lab)
description: Advanced examination of structure and function of skeletal, articular, muscular, and peripheral nervous systems with clinical applications; cadaver lab included.

title: Advanced Networking
description: Analyzing, selecting, configuring, monitoring, and managing of computer network equipment.  SNMP-based monitoring and control in process of fault isolation and root cause analysis.

title: Advanced Obesity & Weight Mgt
description: Etiology, treatment, and prevention of obesity in various populations, emphasizing the role of exercise in weight control programs.

title: Adv Observational Astronomy
description: Advanced techniques of observational astronomy,  emphasizing knowledge and skills necessary to carry out observational scientific investigation in astronomy.

title: Advanced Operations Analytics
description: Apply advanced methods and tools necessary for analyzing and solving problems associated with global supply chain and operations management.

title: Advanced Communication
description: Advanced speaking and listening skills in Japanese including extended narrations, detailed descriptions, and essential oral tasks.

title: Advanced Organic Chemistry
description: Physical aspects of organic chemistry; mechanisms, reaction intermediates, bonding, stereochemical and stereoelectronic effects, molecular orbital theory, Lewis acidity and basicity.

title: Advanced Organic Chemistry
description: Synthetic aspects of organic chemistry; oxidations, reductions, concerted reactions, stereoselectivity, synthetic equivalents, protecting groups. Examples of natural product total synthesis.

title: Adv Path Diag Rsng
description: Pathology underlying complex disease states; physiologic basis for therapy and management.

title: Adv Patho & Genetics/Genomics
description: Effects of genetics/genomics, cellular physiology, and inflammatory and immune response on disease states.

title: Peer Education Level 2
description: Developing advanced-level peer-educating approaches and analytical thinking. Leads to level-two peer education certification of the College Reading and Learning Association.

title: Adv Percep & Cogn Development
description: An advanced examination of early perceptual and cognitive development in human infants and young children.

title: Advanced Phonology
description: Study of sound systems of natural languages using current methods and theories.

title: Advanced Photography
description: Exploration of contemporary art photography designed to help familiarize students with current themes and movements within the medium.  Students will engage in a variety of approaches to photography, while incorporating a conceptual framework in their exploration.

title: Adv Phys Assessment
description: Practical application of physical assessment techniques across the life span.

title: Advanced Physiology
description: Integrated approach to organ system and cellular physiology. Problem solving/calculations.

title: Adv Physiology Lab
description: Experiments and exercises emphasizing problem solving and calculations in human physiology.

title: Politicl Sociology
description: Social basis of political behavior. Modern theories and research concerning use of power and decision making.

title: Adv Portuguese Grammar
description: Applying contemporary grammatical concepts to problems in Portuguese grammar.

title: Advanced Practice Issues
description: Professional theories, roles, issues, ethics, and the use of interprofessional collaboration for advanced-practice nurses.

title: Adv Prac 1: Counseling Psy
description: Clinical experiences conducted primarily through collaboration with BYU's Counseling and Career Center and focusing on career and educational counseling.

title: Adv Prac 2: Coun Psych
description: Clinical experiences and psychotherapeutic training conducted primarily through collaboration with BYU's Counseling and Career Center.

title: Advanced Print Reporting
description: News coverage of government, courts, education, business, international, or legal issues.

title: Adv. Pmk: Book, Ltrprs, Relief
description: Exploring the historical combination of book arts with relief and letterpress printmaking using both traditional and non-traditional forms.

title: Adv Pmk: Intaglio & Monotype
description: Introduces advanced knowledge and technique of intaglio and monotype printmaking beyond Printmaking Fundamentals course.

title: Adv Pmk: Lithography
description: Introduces advanced knowledge and technique of lithography printmaking beyond Printmaking Fundamentals.

title: Adv. Pmk: Screenprint & Riso
description: Introduces advanced knowledge and techniques of screenprint and risograph printmaking beyond Printmaking Fundamentals.

title: Advanced Probability 1
description: Measure-theoretic probability.  Axioms for and construction of probability spaces.  Random variables, expectation, uniform integrability, independence, convergence of sequences of random variables, conditioning.

title: Advanced Probability 2
description: Measure-theoretic stochastic processes.  Martingales, Markov processes, Brownian motion, stochastic integration.

title: Advanced Process Metallurgy
description: An advanced understanding of the fundamental principles of materials science and the effect of advanced manufacturing processes on these principles under non-equilibrium conditions.

title: Adv Prof Financial Accounting
description: Advanced financial accounting topics including pensions, earnings per share, accounting changes, and deferred income taxes.

title: Adv Prof Language Seminar
description: Seminar for Professional Language MA students participating in direct enrollment activities abroad.

title: Adv Prof Lang: Read & Write
description: Advanced-level reading and writing development in the target language.

title: Adv Prof Lang: Speaking
description: Advanced-level speaking and conversational development in the target language.

title: Adv Prototyping Proc & Mater
description: Semi-functional mechanical prototyping.  Includes time in the computer lab building the product to be constructed in the prototyping lab. Incorporation of fasteners, gears, threaded parts, snap features, tactile buttons and complex materials and assemblies in software. Printing, milling, cutting, assembling, and finishing these elements into a fully-functional working product prototype in the lab.

title: Adv Quantum Theory
description: Topics in relativistic quantum mechanics, including quantum field theory.

title: Adv Quantum Theory
description: Topics in relativistic quantum mechanics, including quantum field theory.

title: Advanced Reading Strategies
description: Developing improved speed and comprehension skills through selection and practice of college reading strategies.

title: Advanced Readings
description: Find, read, evaluate and write about ideas in research papers in a specific computer science topic. Instructor sets the topic for the course.

title: Res & Wtg Sec Lang Writers
description: Non-native English speaking students will develop research and writing techniques necessary for graduate-level writing.

title: Adv Research Methods in MFT
description: Advanced marriage and family therapy research methods necessary to produce state-of-the-art clinical research and grant proposals.  Covers the key MFT clinical research methods with an emphasis on the application of these methods to smaller sample sizes typically found in MFT research.  Covers professional writing habits and skills necessary to be productive scholars

title: Research Methods in SW Adv
description: A survey in advanced research methodologies utilized to produce high-quality research in social work and other social sciences.  A hands-on methodological training experience focusing on discussions of methodological approaches and designs, real research questions, and empirical papers.

title: Advanced Science In-Service
description: In-service course for science teachers. Topics vary.

title: Scientific Writing
description: See attached syllabus.

title: Scientific Communication
description: The effective process of written, oral, and visual scientific communication and development of communication skills for scientific and professional audiences. Employment of appropriate research tools and processes in identifying and evaluating sources, and following professional conventions in written and oral communication.

title: Scientific Writing Genetics
description: Course for the genetics and biotechnology major that focuses on field-specific scientific communication including reading, writing, and presenting.

title: Adv Sec Stu Tchg Mthds Art Ed
description: Advanced exploration of media, methods, and pedagogical practices for secondary art classrooms with an emphasis on painting. Includes both art making and curriculum design in preparation for student teaching.

title: Advanced Sedimentology
description: Sedimentology and depositional processes of clastic systems. Focus on different major depositional settings, with classroom discussion based on current research papers. Inputs/outputs of sedimentary systems, the processes involved in the erosion/deposition/transport of sediment, preservation potential and resulting bedforms derived from depositional processes, and interpretation of paleoenvironmental conditions based on preserved strata.  Focus on the ancient rock record, modern analogs, and to a lesser extent process-based computer modeling as three different ways to build a more comprehensive understanding.

title: Advanced Sedimentology
description: Sedimentology and depositional processes of clastic systems. Focus on different major depositional settings, with classroom discussion based on current research papers. Inputs/outputs of sedimentary systems, the processes involved in the erosion/deposition/transport of sediment, preservation potential and resulting bedforms derived from depositional processes, and interpretation of paleoenvironmental conditions based on preserved strata.  Focus on the ancient rock record, modern analogs, and to a lesser extent process-based computer modeling as three different ways to build a more comprehensive understanding.

title: Advanced Semantics
description: Semantic theory and applications including quantification, modality, aspect, presupposition, contexts, focus, polarity, and pragmatics.

title: Advanced Seminar
description: Acquiring advanced understanding within a specialized domain of instructional psychology and technology through experiences with guest lecturers and experts in the domain.

title: Adv Seminar in Beh Neurosci
description: Critical examination of recent topics and interests within behavioral neuropsychology.

title: Adv Seminar in Devlpmntl Psych
description: A critical examination of recent topics and interests within developmental psychology.

title: Adv Sem Psychological Anthro
description: Special topics in psychological anthropology.

title: Adv Seminar in Social Psych
description: A critical examination of recent topics and interests within social psychology.

title: Adv Seminar on Current Issues
description: Briefings and lectures from government officials and agencies, as well as directed readings on current issues.

title: Advanced Senior Research
description: Special project course for advanced Cell Biology and Physiology research students.  Engaging in scientific research as specified in an approved research proposal.  Comprehensive written work of research required.

title: Adv Sewing Studies:Constructn
description: Three-dimensional fitting of apparel and advanced garment sewing and construction techniques.

title: Adv Sewing: Patternmaking
description: Flat pattern design, basic drafting, and basic draping for apparel.

title: Advanced Shading
description: Advanced shading, rendering, and lighting methods for creating virtual scenes that emphasize story and innovatively meet an art director's vision through traditional and procedural methods.

title: Adv Short-term Act Math
description: Advanced modeling of short term contingent risks including the development and use of compound models such as the Poisson-Gamma probability models and their variants. Bayesian methods to construct posterior distributions of loss. Prepares for SOA Exam ASTAM.

title: Advanced Social Development
description: An advanced examination of early social and emotional development in children, including parent-child and peer relationships as well as the development of social cognition.

title: Advanced Social Impact
description: Focuses on the study of high-impact social benefit organizations in nonprofit, governmental, church, education, for-profit, and hybrid environments. Advanced focus on using measurement and evaluation metrics to support long term project funding.

title: Advanced Social Psychology
description: Processes of social influence, emphasizing theory and research testing. Basic principles of social behavior.

title: Adv Software Construction
description: Advanced software development with an object-oriented focus. Design, implementation, and testing of medium-sized programs including a server program.

title: Advanced Soil Mechanics
description: Advanced discussion and analysis of shear strength of soils; finite-element stress analysis distribution in soils; critical state soil mechanics, unsaturated soil mechanics.

title: Advanced Special Projects
description: This is a course that provides mentoring and inspiring learning for advanced students collaborating with a faculty member on a professional media project.

title: Adv Special Topics in Topology
description: Current topics in topology of research interest.

title: Advanced Spoken Arabic
description: Movies, plays, and other texts in spoken Arabic.

title: Adv Spreadsheets Bus Analysis
description: Focus on learning advanced functionality of spreadsheets to support business analysis and decision making. Topics covered include names, dates and times, debugging, arrays and array formulas, counting and summing techniques, pivot tables, data importing and cleaning, text manipulation, advanced decision making, and more.

title: Advanced Statistical Analysis
description: Advanced topics in econometrics, building on basic linear regression learned in Political Science 328.

title: Stat & Data Anlys & SW Res Adv
description: Commonly used statistical analyses based on the linear regression model; useful with data or analyses violating one or more assumptions of the OLS regression model.  Improved modeling of mediating relationships (SEM), using clustered data, longitudinal data, and issues of selection.

title: STEM Curriculum & Development
description: Strategies for teaching a variety of topics.  Developing and implementing integrated STEM curricula.

title: Advanced STEM Pedagogy
description: Inquiry-based pedagogies characteristic of STEM education applying contemporary theories of teaching and learning.  Integrating STEM disciplines through a variety of instructional strategies and models.

title: Advanced Storyboarding
description: Exploring the professional practices of storyboard artists in advertising, film, TV, and animation through individual and group projects.

title: Advanced Strategy & Consulting
description: Strategy consulting, working with client companies to scope engagements, perform work, deliver analysis and recommendations, and assist in initial implementation.

title: Advanced Strategy & Consulting
description: Strategy consulting, working with client companies to scope engagements, perform work, deliver analysis and recommendations, and assist in initial implementation.

title: Advanced Strategy & Consulting
description: Strategy consulting, working with client companies to scope engagements, perform work, deliver analysis and recommendations, and assist in initial implementation.

title: Adv Stratigraphy
description: Studying the stratigraphic record through modern methods of correlating stratal packages, emphasizing concepts of sequence and seismic stratigraphy, and utilizing methods of chronostratigraphy, biostratigraphy, lithostratigraphy, and absolute dating. Extended field trip required.

title: Advanced Structure
description: In-depth discussions of a variety of topics in structural geology, emphasizing current literature and problems.

title: Adv Structural Steel Design
description: Background and development of AISC specification, AISC seismic provisions, and relevant provisions in ASCE 7: design of steel braced frames and steel moment resisting frames; design of diaphragms and collectors; design of steel buildings.

title: Adv Studies in French Culture
description: In-depth study of French historical, political, and social issues or artistic trends.

title: Adv Studies in French Ling
description: Advanced study of linguistic features such as phonetics and phonology, semantization, lexical development, morphology, and contrastive syntax.

title: Advanced Studio
description: Individual development of art issues in advanced studio environment. Writing a proposal accompanied by a readings list.

title: Advanced Studio Workshop
description: Studies in improvisation, choreography and repertory in a studio workshop environment. Teacher approval required.

title: Advanced Syntax
description: Theory of generative grammar, emphasizing its history, the competition between different versions of generative theory, and their recent extensions.

title: Advanced Taxation
description: Tax laws as they apply to selected tax entities, with an introduction to tax research methodology.

title: Advanced Techniques in HCI
description: This class combines designing the user experience with implementing the technology. Students learn website design, information architecture, and how to design for the broader ecosystem of use. Finally, students will learn principles specifically relevant to website design and information architecture. Web design is one of the most common UX jobs and so this makes their skills highly marketable.

title: Adv NMR Techniques
description: Introduction to techniques such as DEPT, COSY, HETCOR, ROESY, INADEQUATE, HMQC, HSQC, and HMBC.

title: Advanced Stage Management
description: Advanced techniques and projects in stage management.

title: Adv Theory in MFT
description: Advanced family therapy approaches to the diagnosis and treatment of affective, behavioral, and cognitive disorders.

title: Adv Theor Grp Coun
description: Theory and methods of group counseling; advanced skills in conducting group therapy.

title: Adv Thermodynamics
description: Advanced topics of thermodynamics, including electrolytes, phase equilibrium modeling, nonequilibrium thermodynamics, and calorimetry.

title: Advanced Tool Design
description: Advanced design of net-shape products utilizing CAD and CAE methods. Plastic injection mold design and construction. Rapid prototyping and injection molding project.

title: Advanced Topics
description: Developing increased understanding and competency in a specific area of instructional psychology and technology through focused learning of a narrow topic.

title: Adv Topics in Analytical Chem
description: The following topics are rotated:  Spectroscopy Methods of Analysis, Separation Methods of Analysis, and Mass Spectrometry.

title: Adv Topics in ANES
description: Seminar involving in-depth examination of an ancient Near Eastern topic and then writing about it.

title: Adv Study Arab
description: Advanced studies in Arabic language and literature.

title: Adv Topics in Beharioral Neuro
description: A critical examination of recent topics and interests within behavioral neuroscience.

title: Adv Topics in Biochemistry
description: The following topics are rotated:  cellular signal transduction, clinical chemistry, biochemical immunology, bioinorganic chemistry, genetic modeling of human disease, molecular biology of cancer, regulatory RNA, proteomics, and structural biochemistry.

title: Adv Topics-Cell Bio & Physiol
description: Advanced undergraduate or graduate-level course in topics relating to cell biology and physiology. Topics vary. 550R courses have a defined curriculum, including graded assignments and exams. Expectations and learning outcomes will be specified in the syllabus.

title: Adv Topics in Human Anatomy
description: Applied clinical anatomy lectures and lab exercises.

title: Adv Topics in Computer Sci
description: Advanced undergraduate- and graduate-level subjects as announced before each semester.

title: Adv Topics in Comptr Security
description: Advanced topics and reading in computer security.

title: Advanced Computer Vision 1
description: Advanced topics in computer vision reflecting current areas of interest in the field and related applications.

title: Adv Topics in Data Mining
description: Data mining process, data warehousing concepts, text mining, ethical issues, meta-learning, and key success factors.

title: Adv Topics in Dev Psychology
description: A critical examination of recent topics and interests within developmental psychology.

title: Adv Topics Ecology & Evolution
description: Current topics in ecology, evolution, and systematics.

title: Adv Top Human Obesity
description: Neuro-endocrine, genetic, physiologic, and psychological determinants of human obesity; evaluation of current treatments and preventative measures with diet, activity, and behavior modification.

title: Adv Top Inorg Chem
description: The following topics are rotated: chemistry of the main group elements, chemistry of the transition elements.

title: Adv Keyboard Harmony
description: Topics vary.

title: Advanced Topics in MFT
description: Seminar on advanced topics in marriage and family therapy.

title: Advanced Topics in Music
description: Topics vary.

title: Adv Top Org&Biomolecular Chem
description: The following topics are rotated:  bioorganic chemistry, natural products chemistry, organic heterocyclic chemistry, organic photochemistry, and organometallic chemistry.

title: Advanced Topics in Philosophy
description: Selected topics in philosophy.

title: Adv Top Phys Chem
description: The following topics are rotated: advanced chemical thermodynamics, quantum chemistry.

title: Adv Topics in P M  & Rehab
description: Topics will be rotated and may include: electrotherapy, ultrasound, and diathermy; cryotherapy; orthotics; clinical and educational administration; functional testing and exercise; neural basis of rehabilitation; strength rehabilitation; joint mobilization and manual therapy; spinal manipulation and mobilization.

title: Advanced Topics in Physics
description: Recent and upcoming topics include chaos, thin films, phase transformations, amorphous solids, quantum optics, astronomy using nontraditional frequencies, and particle physics.

title: Adv Topics in Science Educatn
description: Current topics in biological science education.

title: Adv Topics: Signals & Systems
description: Subjects that may be offered include: information theory, optimal estimation theory, system identification, advanced image processing, pattern recognition

title: Adv Topics in Social Psych
description: A critical examination of recent topics and interests within social psychology.

title: Adv Tpcs Theo Phys
description: Applications of tensor analysis, differential geometry, and differential forms to such topics as mechanics, optics, relativity, and fluid dynamics.

title: Adv Topics in Theoretical Phy
description: Advanced group theory. Space groups and lie groups with applications in solid-state physics (energy band representations, phase transitions, etc.), nuclear physics, and quantum field theory (particle classification schemes, etc.).

title: Adv Tpcs Theo Phys
description: Introductory group theory. Basic representation theory and developments, with applications to quantum mechanics and molecular and solid-state physics.

title: Adv Undergraduate Research
description: Advanced research laboratory experience for students interested in cell biology and physiology.

title: Adv VC/PE Strategies, Part 1
description: Applied experience in venture capital and private equity, conducting due diligence on clients, industry, competition; observing and participating in deal structure; tracking progress of funded client companies.

title: Adv VC/PE Strategies, Part 2
description: Applied experience in venture capital and private equity, conducting due diligence on clients, industry, competition; observing and participating in deal structure; tracking progress of funded client companies.

title: Advanced Venture Studio
description: An advanced course empowering student leaders through hands-on client work for entrepreneurs.  This course follows MBA 678 and goes further into identifying and acquiring critical resources for early companies.  These resources include operations support, work space, and financial capital.  Students provide clients state-of-the-art support functions in tactical operations, sales and marketing, people organizations, legal and compliance, and engineering and product development at various stages of business development.

title: Advanced Venture Studio
description: An advanced course empowering student leaders through hands-on client work for entrepreneurs. This course goes further into identifying and acquiring critical resources for early companies. These resources include operations support, work space, and financial capital. Students provide clients state-of-the-art support functions in tactical operations, sales and marketing, people organizations, legal and compliance, and engineering and product development at various stages of business development.

title: Adv. Visual Storytelling
description: Teaches students the tools and techniques employed by directors, cinematographers, production designers, and editors in the telling of meaningful stories through the creation of purposeful images. Students watch, read, analyze, and practice the craft of filmmaking.

title: Web Development
description: Web development techniques, emphasizing client-side programming, programming language details, and front-end libraries and frameworks.

title: Advanced Web Technologies
description: Practical application of the latest evolving web technologies. Topics include HTMLS, CSS/SASS, JavaScript, NodeJS, Polymer, noSQL, asynchronous programming, functional programming, event driven systems, debugging, testing, workflow optimization, and deployment pipelines.

title: Advanced Worksite Wellness
description: Management for effectively designing, marketing, implementing, and administering health promotion programs.

title: Advanced Writing
description: Not a valid course. Only to be used to apply credits to General Education requirements.

title: Adv Writing for Dance
description: This course will expose students to rhetorical principles and situations encountered in the field of dance. Students will refine skills in various genres of academic, persuasive and professional writing, as well as oral communication, supporting their development as dance artists, scholars, educators and advocates.  \n

title: Adv Wrtg for Educators
description: Writing 313 is an advanced course in composition with the purpose of teaching research, writing, and oral communication skills needed for careers in education and teaching.

title: Adv Wrtg in Comp Arts & Hum
description: Introduction to the language, methods, and purpose of academic argument, oral and written.  Core principles behind academic argumentation and its relevance to logical thinking and effective communication.

title: Advances in Human Development
description: Recent advances in developmental psychology emphasizing infant development as it informs our understanding of perceptual, cognitive, linguistic, and social development in later childhood.

title: Positive Psychology in ExDM
description: Topics and recent advances in positive psychology as they apply to experience design.

title: Adversarial & Cyber Mindset
description: Adversarial mindset and tactics; architectural and human vulnerabilities and strategies for protecting against them; cybersecurity terminology; threat actors and risk; ethical responsibility; management and governance considerations.

title: Advertising Account Management
description: Managing advertising agency accounts, including budgets, writing, new business pitches, and relationships with clients.

title: Advertising & Promotion
description: Key issues facing marketing managers when promoting products and services. Cases, readings, and research on the elements of effective communication strategies and promotional programs.

title: Advertising & Promotion Mgmt
description: Strategies in promoting business and nonbusiness products, services, and institutions, including the role of advertising, promotion, target selection, media and copy decisions, and marketing research.

title: Advertising Research Methods
description: Quantitative research methods used in marketing and advertising; the research process; planning, designing, and conducting studies; analyzing results using appropriate methodologies.

title: Advocacy for Physical Educ
description: Historical and sociological cornerstones of physical education.

title: Advocacy in PETE
description: History, concepts, issues, current trends, and professional practices associated with becoming an effective advocate for physical education at local, regional, and national levels.

title: Aerial Dance Tech
description:
A hybrid dance form, where movement training, strength, and
athletic awareness come together to allow students to create their own Aerial Dance Act.
Apparatuses available to explore include Hoop (Lyra), Corde Lisse (Rope), Straps, and
Silks. Time and focus of class is divided evenly between composition, conditioning and
new skill development, students are encouraged to transfer a broad range of previous
movement knowledge to this vertical art form. The course culminates in an informal
showing to a campus wide audience.

title: Aerodynamics
description: Predict aerodynamic forces and moments, like lift and drag, for 2D airfoils, 3D wings, and rotating blades across a range of Mach and Reynolds numbers. Utilize modern computational and aerodynamic methods.

title: Aerospace Defense
description: U.S. Air Force Major Command structure and the origins of the Air Force.

title: Aero Structural Dynamic Test
description: Strategies for identifying mathematical models of dynamic systems from time and frequency response measurements, experiment design, digital data acquisition methods and modern sensors. Eigenvalue problems for lumped parameter systems and corresponding experimental modal analysis methods. Introduction to signal processing, the fast Fourier transform, and correlation of measurements with finite element models.

title: Aesthetics
description: Fundamental questions of aesthetic theory from classical antiquity to the present, emphasizing musical aesthetics.

title: Africa South of the Sahara
description: Geographical analysis focusing on resource management, political issues, development, environmental problems, economic development, and urban-rural change; case studies from selected countries.

title: African Portuguese Lit
description: Modern authors from the five African nations whose official language is Portuguese: Angola, Cabo Verde, Guine Bissau, Mozambique, and the two-island republic Sao Tome and Principe. Authors include Jose Craveirinha, Mia Couto, Noemia de Sousa, Jose Tenreiro, Castro Soromenho, Luandino Vieira, Pepetala, and Baltasar Lopes, among others.

title: African Portuguese Lit
description: Modern authors from the five African nations whose official language is Portuguese: Angola Cabo Verde, Guine Bissau, Mozambique, and Sao Tome Pricipe. Authors include Jose Craveirinha, Mia Couto, Noemia de Sousa, Jose Tenreiro, Castro Soromenho, Luandino Vieira, Pepetala, Baltasar Lopes, among others.

title: African Politics
description: Processes of change and development of nation states; African regionalism and relations with other nations; contemporary political issues.

title: African Social Change
description: Themes and questions in African social history throughout various periods, including women, youth, religion, health, and cross-cultural interactions.

title: African-Am Hist since 1865
description: Social, economic, intellectual, political factors; struggle for racial equality; race and gender relationships; how changing ideas of race affect American life and politics.

title: Agribusiness Management 1
description: Concepts, tools, and approaches to understanding competitive forces and the development of sustainable competitive advantage for firms in the food, fiber, and horticulture industries.

title: Agribusiness Management 2
description: Developing and implementing marketing plans and programs for companies participating in the value chain of agribusiness industries.

title: Air Force ROTC Auxiliary
description: Additional voluntary practical military training for Air Force ROTC cadets. The Honor Guard and Special Tactics each focus on leadership, problem solving, team building, and communication in an effort to better prepare cadets for the rigors of military service.

title: Air Quality Assessment Lab
description: This course provides lab-based instruction to students on the technical aspects of conducting air quality exposure assessments. This course covers theory and application of sampling methods used to evaluate chemical, biological, and physical exposures; interpretation of sampling results; and identification of appropriate control strategies to prevent hazardous exposures.

title: Algebra 1
description: Group theory, ring theory.

title: Algebra 2
description: Modules, vector spaces, field theory, Galois theory.

title: Algebra 3
description: Topics from representation theory of finite groups and associative algebras. Groebner bases, homological algebra, tensor algebras, commutative rings, advanced finite group theory.

title: Algebraic Geometry 1
description: Basic definitions and theorems on varieties, sheaves, and schemes.

title: Algebraic Geometry 2
description: Cohomology of schemes.  Classification problems.  Applications.

title: Algebraic Reasoning
description: Fundamental concepts (e.g., variables, equality, pattern recognition, function, covariation, equations), processes (e.g., mathematizing, generalizing, modeling), and research in algebraic reasoning.

title: Algebraic Topology
description: A rigorous treatment of the fundamentals of homology and cohomology of spaces: simplicial, singular, and cellular homology; excision; Mayer-Vietoris sequence; homology with coefficients; homology and the fundamental group; universal coefficient theory; cup product; and Poincare Duality.

title: Algorithm Design & Analysis
description: A study of the design and analysis of algorithms as solutions to problems, including dynamic programming, linear programming, greedy algorithms, divide-and-conquer algorithms, graph algorithms, and intelligent search algorithms.

title: Algorithm Design & Opt 1
description: A treatment of algorithms used to solve problems.  Topics include complexity and data, approximation theory, recursive algorithms, linear optimization, unconstrained optimization, constrained optimization, global optimization.

title: Algorithm Design & Opt 1 Lab
description: Programming algorithms and using functions to implement the optimization algorithms taught in Math 320.  Applications presented.  Developing models and applying results of computations to the application domain.

title: Algorithm Design & Opt 2
description: Algorithms used to solve dynamic programming problems and advanced computing problems.  Topics include finite-horizon and infinite-horizon dynamic programming, discrete transforms, compressed sensing, heuristics, branch and bound, conditioning and stability.

title: Algorithm Design & Opt 2 Lab
description: Using existing software and writing code for algorithms taught in Math 322.  Applications presented.  Developing models and applying results to the application domain.

title: Algorithmic Lang & Compilers
description: Formal description of algorithmic languages and techniques used in their compilation:  semantics, ambiguities, procedures, replication, iteration, recursion.

title: Alt Dispute Reso
description: Theory and practice of dispute resolution, emphasizing alternatives to traditional litigation such as negotiation, mediation, and arbitration as well as "hybrids."

title: Alt Photo Processes
description: Advanced studio photography course exploring colloidal and other alternative photographic processes.

title: Amer Architecture
description: Major figures, monuments, and movements in American architecture from colonial period through "Gilded Age."

title: American Art 1876-1950
description: Survey of American painting and sculpture from 1876-1950.

title: American Art to 1876
description: This course examines American art and architecture from the Pre-Columbian period to 1876.

title: American Capitalism
description: Examines how economic thought has been translated into economic policy in the United States during the twentieth century.

title: American Christianity
description: History, doctrine, and practices of the major Christian faiths of America in light of the restored gospel.

title: American Clog Dance, Beginning
description: Fundamentals of clogging

title: American Culture
description: Literature, philosophy, and/or the arts of American culture.

title: American Culture
description: Perspectives and methods for making sense of mainstream middle-class American society; American ways of being-in-the-world, of believing, behaving, and belonging; American cultural themes.

title: Western Square & Amer Dance
description: Traditional American dance forms including country western line, round, square and contra dance.

title: American Folklore
description: American folk art and literature and the historical and cultural circumstances from which they developed.

title: Am Government & Politics
description: Not a valid course. Only to be used to apply credits to General Education requirements.

title: Amer Government & Politics
description: Origin and development of federal Constitution; national, state, and local governments and politics.

title: American Heritage
description: Synthesis of American constitutional and economic principles, and patterns of historical development.

title: Am Indian Hist 1877-present
description: North American Indian history from 1877 to the present day, including the history and culture of various American Indian nations, their trade, diplomacy, and military campaigns with the United States, and historical and sociocultural factors affecting nineteenth- and twentieth-century American Indians in both urban and reservation settings, and current challenges facing American Indian communities.

title: Am Indian Hist to 1877
description: North American Indian history before and after European colonization up to 1877, including Native cultures, politics, religion, diplomacy, war, trade, and interactions with other nations as well as with European colonists and the United States government.

title: American Judicial Politics
description: The role of the U.S. judiciary, particularly the U.S. Supreme Court, in American politics, including discussion of the structure, role, influences, and policymaking role.\n\n

title: American Legal History
description: Survey of American law from the colonial and early national period to the present with special emphasis on public law, federal-state relations, individual rights, legal thought, judicial review, legal institutions, and civil procedure.

title: American Literary History
description: Development of ideas, movements, genres, and styles in American literature as illustrated through representative texts.

title: American Literature after 1800
description: Representative writers, genres, and literary trends of American literature after 1800.

title: American Lit before 1800
description: Representative writers, genres, and literary trends of American literature before 1800.

title: American Political Parties
description: Electoral and policy-making roles of American political parties today and their future in American politics.

title: American Regional Literature
description: Literature and cultural representations of a given American region.

title: Adv. Conversation
description: Engage in conversation across a variety of topics with a focus on improving language production.

title: Basic Conversation
description: Students will be engaged in Novice level communication, allowing for growth into Novice High to Intermediate Low levels.  Topics of beginning conversation will include family, school, work and personal interests.  Students will have the opportunity to practice previously developed skills in a conversational setting while increasing vocabulary and concepts in ASL related to beginning conversational levels.

title: ASL Intermediate Conversation
description: Students will engage in Intermediate level communication, allowing for growth into Intermediate High to Advanced Low levels.  Topics of intermediate conversation will include further exploration of family, school, work and personal interests as well as descriptions and narrations.  Students will have the opportunity to practice previously developed skills in a conversational setting while increasing vocabulary and concepts in ASL related to intermediate and some advanced conversational levels.

title: American South
description: Political, economic, and cultural history of the southern states from colonial times to the present.

title: American Studies Capstone
description: In-depth review of American Studies theories, methods, and criticism; content varies; requires original research and substantial writing of paper intended for publication.

title: Lecture Series
description: Introduce research in American Studies and Western American Studies. Speakers from BYU and other institutions share their research. Students engage with lecturers by developing questions, then evaluate and write about ideas.

title: Methods and Writing Practices
description: Offers students a practical grounding in American Studies methodologies and approaches to writing.

title: American West to 1900
description: The American West as a place of great diversity.  Topics include Native American societies, European colonization, explorations, the fur trade, overland migrations, Indian relations, mining, settlement, and the environment.

title: Introduction to the Humanities
description: Study of the arts emphasizing forms and relationships, the development of critical skills, and an awareness of traditional humanistic values.

title: Analog CMOS Ccts
description: Design of CMOS switched-capacitor circuits, DAC architectures, ADC architectures, Nyquist and oversampling architectures

title: Analog Motion
description: Interdisciplinary course with a focus on stop motion animation. Illustration, photography, graphic design, animation, and hybrid majors will apply their existing skills towards the creation of short-form works using a multi-plane setup. The course is a balanced mix of theory and practice, with detailed instruction on montage, efficient storytelling, animation techniques, and the complete production pipeline. Students will complete projects for both commercial and entertainment applications. A playful, experimental approach is encouraged as students learn the foundational principles of motion design. This course has no prerequisites.

title: Analogical Modelng
description: Nondeclarative approaches to language description; work within the connectionist or neural net framework; analogical or exemplar modeling.

title: Analysis of Populations
description: Exposure to common tools for analysis and management of plant and animal populations.  Program mark, program distance, movement and home range analysis, point pattern analysis, etc.

title: Analysis & Trmt of Sex Devel
description: Knowledge and skill required to analyze and treat questions related to human sexual development.

title: Analysis of Complex Genomes
description: Assembly and analysis of eukaryotic genomes, including the theory underlying and application of commonly used methods.  First in a two-course series.

title: Analysis of Correlated Data
description: IID regression, heterogenous variances, SARIMA models, longitudinal data, point and areally referenced spatial data.

title: Genomic Analysis
description: Practical training in computational analysis of genetics and genomic data to accompany theoretical training in genomics. Introduction to coding, statistics, and graphics analysis in R, as well as applied training in genomics techniques. Designed for non-bioinformatic students.

title: Analytical Cartography
description: Geocoding, spatial data representation, spatial algorithms, and map based transformations.

title: Ancient Laws
description: Comparative study of legal topics in the law codes and legal systems of the Old Testament, legal narratives in the New Testament, the trials of Jesus and Paul, and the legal cases in the Book of Mormon, as well as the codes of the Sumerians, Babylonians, Hittites, Assyrians, and Greek and Roman law.

title: Ancient Literary Criticism
description: Survey emphasizing both chief works of the tradition and their practical application to reading of Greek and Latin authors.

title: Ancient Near East  to 330 BC
description: Ancient cultures of the Near East (Egypt, Mesopotamia, Syro-Palestine, Anatolia, Iran) from the beginnings of civilization to the conquests of Alexander the Great.

title: Ancient Near East 330BC-640AD
description: Cultures and empires of the Near East (Persia, Hellenistic kingdoms, Judaism, early Christianity, Rome, and Byzantium) from Alexander the Great to the Arab conquests.

title: Ancnt Near Eastern Mythology
description: Major themes in mythological literature of Egypt, Canaan, Mesopotamia, Anatolia, and ancient Iran. All readings in English.

title: Ancient Near Eastern Studies
description: Social science/humanities core course emphasizing ancient history extending to the Byzantine period.

title: Andean South America
description: This course will cover archaeological, historical, ethnographic, and art historical perspectives on the development of societies and cultures in the Central Andes from the earliest settlements to the present day, with special focus on archaeology and ethnohistory from ca. 3000 BCAD 1700. \n

title: Andean South America
description: This course will cover archaeological, historical, ethnographic, and art historical perspectives on the development of societies and cultures in the Central Andes from the earliest settlements to the present day, with special focus on archaeology and ethnohistory from ca. 3000 BCAD 1700.\n

title: Angiosperm Phylogeny
description: Description, classification, phylogeny, and geographic distribution of flowering plant families.

title: Anim Disease, Zoonoses
description: Animal disease emphasizing prevention, organ systems affected, biosecurity, and zoonotic potential.

title: Animal Husbandry
description: Introduction to animal husbandry and management techniques for domestic and wild animals.

title: Animated Film Production 1
description: Early development of a film, including character design, environments, pipeline, visual effects, and the look and feel the film. All pre-visualization of the film. Practice collaborative production processes through interdisciplinary creative works or experiences.

title: Animated Film Production 2
description: In-depth experiences creating computer animations and visual effects.  Senior film front-end development and introduction to full animation production.

title: Animated Film Production 3
description: Portfolio development based on advanced animation/design projects. Senior film production and post production.

title: Antennas & Wireless Commun
description: Antenna analysis, array theory, and propagation channel models with application to wireless communication systems.

title: Anthropological Linguistics
description: Language in culture and society: development, typology, and description.

title: Anthro of Latter-day Saints
description: Intensive analysis of Latter-day Saint society and culture using a range of anthropological perspectives.

title: Anthropology Seminar
description: Weekly anthropology seminars in which anthropologists and archaeologists from across the country (as well as from the Department of Anthropology) will present their latest research. An opportunity for students to learn about the most up-to-date research currently being conducted by anthropologists and archaeologists.

title: Antitrust Law
description: Development of legal doctrine under the Sherman Act and supplemental legislation, including price fixing, division of market, monopolization, mergers, tying and exclusive dealing arrangements, boycotts, and special relationships between principles of patent and antitrust law. Emphasis: the relationships between principles of law and economics, examined in the context of certain key cases.

title: Aphasia
