description: Perspectives on the neurology, clinical assessment, and rehabilitation of aphasic language disturbances in adults.

title: Appellate Brief Writing
description: Persuasive writing techniques, organization, strategy-priority of arguments, handling a circuit split, policy arguments, standards of review, persuasion techniques, handling adverse authority, and effective counter argument.

title: Appellate Practice & Procedure
description: Explores a range of procedural issues that arise in appellate litigation in the federal and state courts, including preservation of issues; appealability; parties on appeal; perfecting an appeal; relief pending appeal; and standards of review. Students will consider these issues as they arise in cases and rules in federal and state appellate systems, with some comparative analysis of the differences between the two systems.

title: App Lang Skills: Domain Spec
description: Domain-specific listening, speaking, reading and writing in the target language.

title: Instrumentation for MFGEN
description: An introduction to industrial sensors and data acquisition. Students will learn about and gain experience with different sensors, how they work, what they measure, how to use them, and how to make sense of the data.

title: Applications in Biostatistics
description: Module-based survey of biostatistics methods: observational studies, clinical trials, measures of association, Kaplan-Meier, proportional hazards models, logistic regression, ethical concerns in research with human subjects.

title: Applications of Fluid Dynamics
description: Control volume analysis; introduction to CFD; boundary layers; lift and drag, airfoils; pumps, propellers, compressors, turbines; hydroelectric and wind power generation; real world applications.

title: Appl Quantum Mechanics
description: Applications of quantum mechanics to atomic, molecular, statistical, condensed-matter, and nuclear physics; elementary particles.

title: Applied Accounting Analytics
description: Understand various applications employed in accounting and business data analytics. Focus on how people perceive, process, and encode visual and textual information and how to select the most appropriate methods to present qualitative and quantitative data.  \n

title: Applied Accounting Technology
description: Deepen understanding of the application of technology to perform, document, test, attest, and automate accounting procedures and controls through hands-on use of industry leading and emerging technologies.

title: Applied Microbiology
description: Science of the microbiological tests performed in various industries.  Sterilization, aseptic processing, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, water treatment, and food microbiology.

title: Applied Anthropology
description: Study of examples of applied research in a number of settings including: business, education, environment, government, communication, international development, or health sectors. Engagement in applied research projects involving application of anthropological research methods to real world problems.

title: Applied Bayesian Statistics
description: Bayesian analogs of t-tests, regression, ANOVA, ANCOVA, logistic regression, and Poisson regression implemented using Nimble, Stan, JAGS and Proc MCMC.

title: Appl Behavior Analysis in Ed
description: Foundational principles of human behavior and application of those principles in working with individuals with disabilities.

title: Behavioral Assessment&Intrvntn
description: Functional assessment of behaviors using formal and informal behavioral observations. Utilizing collected data to develop and monitor behavioral interventions.

title: Applied Biostatistics
description: Application-first statistics for biologists taught in the R environment.

title: Clinical Data Sys in Pub Hlth
description: This course  introduces students to the varied types and usage of clinically acquired data in public health. Students will use statistical programming to analyze clinically acquired data.

title: Applied Discrete Probability
description: Rigorous probability without the use of measure theory.  Intensive study of finite and countable probability spaces.  Applications to particle statistics, random walks, Markov decision processes, information theory, and asset pricing.

title: Applied Econometrics
description: Application of econometric methods, introduction to research design, and evaluation of empirical research.  Special attention given to linking economic theory and econometrics and to causal inference.

title: Applied EM & Optics
description: Principles and methods of modern electromagnetic wave theory: Green functions, Huygen's principle, diffraction, radiation and scattering. Application of theory including beam propagation and image formation.

title: Applied Engineering Math
description: Advanced engineering mathematics that builds a foundation for graduate mechanical engineering courses and research. Topics include tensor analysis, vector calculus, and solution methods for partial differential equations.

title: Applied English
description: Applying skills developed in the English major to a professional setting.

title: Grammar for Intrnl Students
description: Increasing correct grammar use in academic writing.

title: Applied International Health
description: Engaging in an applied international health experience.

title: Applied Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Brass Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Organ Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Percussion Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Piano Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: String Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Vocal Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: Woodwind Literature
description: Advanced survey and research of literature.

title: GeoMathematics
description: Provides a broad survey of mathematical methods that are relevant for geological problems. Focuses on casting geological problems in mathematical terms and solving them. Strong emphasis on setting up equations and on the quality of written solutions.

title: Applied Patho in Nursing
description: 3-credit, in-person didactic course integrates knowledge from physiology, chemistry, microbiology, and nursing care in learning new knowledge about pathophysiology, disease processes, evidence-based health care interventions, and implications for nursing care for all body organ systems.

title: Applied Pharmacology
description: Experience in prescribing and managing drug therapy in patients with a variety of conditions and across the life span.

title: Applied Pharm in Nursing
description: Common categories of drugs: their action, use and desired and undesired effects; implications for nursing care.

title: Applied R Programming
description: R programming skills; data cleaning and wrangling in R;  introductory statistical analysis and graphics; simulation of introductory statistical concepts.

title: Applied SAS Programming
description: Advanced SAS programming skills, advanced DATA step programming, ODS, simple MACRO programs, Proc SQL, Proc REPORT, communicate with other packages and programs.

title: Applied Social Psychology
description: Overview of domains in which social psychological theory and research have been applied in field settings.

title: Applied Social Psychology
description: Applying social psychological theory, research, and methods to such domains as law, business, education, the media, mental health, and physical health.

title: Applied Social Rsrch Methods
description: Research methods training for conducting research in applied settings using social research methods such as needs assessments, social impact analysis, and program evaluations.

title: Applied Stats/Data Management
description: Data management, statistical methods, data visualization and presentation, and research documentation, with data about families.

title: Statistics for Lawyers
description: Reinforces statistical knowledge gained in Poli 200 and prepares knowledgeable consumers of empirical social science research for careers in law and policy analysis.

title: Appl Stats in Adv SLA Research
description: Apply statistical procedures in research studies and program evaluations.

title: Applied Statistics
description: This course applies statistical principles to social science problems by utilizing the basics of statistical software in developing and testing research questions as well as conducting univariate and multivariate statistics such as t-tests, ANOVAs, and regression models.

title: Applied Thermodynamics
description: Applied engineering thermodynamics including air and steam power cycles, thermodynamic relations, and introduction to combustion and equilibrium chemical reactions.

title: Applying to Graduate School
description: Overview of graduate programs in psychology; preparing application materials, including the Graduate Record Examination. (GRE).

title: Ways of Being an Artist
description: A broad theoretical and historical framework for the production and understanding of contemporary creative practices, including those that are interdisciplinary. Content integrated with and applied in other core and advanced studio courses.

title: Approaches to Screen Directing
description: Practice, view, study, and analyze various cinematic techniques and elements in order to create emphasis for film audiences. The course helps students identify and express the multiple storytelling points of view associated with fiction film direction.

title: Aqua Fitness
description: Exercise workout in water emphasizing flexibility, strength, and endurance.

title: Aquatic&Terrestrial Biogeochem
description: An in-depth treatment of global biogeochemical cycles, focusing on cycles of carbon, oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur in the atmosphere, hydrosphere, and lithosphere.  Special attention will be given to the microbial mediated transformations and the impact of human disturbances in terrestrial and aquatic environments.

title: Aquatic Biology
description: Independent student research under faculty supervision.

title: Aquatic Entomology
description: Morphology, classification, biology, and functional ecology of aquatic insects. Field trips required.

title: Arab Women Authors
description: Reading and discussion of a selection of works by leading women authors from the Arab world. Both readings and discussions are in Arabic.

title: Arab-Palestn-Israeli Conflct
description: Emphasizes historical background, current situation, and alternatives leading to conflict resolution.

title: Arabic Grammar Review
description: Tutorial review of first- and second-year Arabic grammar, with readings and other activities that illustrate the principles discussed.

title: Arabic Lang Teaching Methods
description: Language acquisition theories and instructional practices specific to Arabic language classrooms at various levels.  Lectures, demonstrations, microteaching.

title: Arbitration
description: Arbitration is an adversarial, evidentiary, adjudication process (like a less formal, private bench trial) in which parties submit a dispute for a (usually binding) decision by an arbitrator (or a panel of three  arbitrators). Arbititration can be either mandatory or voluntary, and binding or non-binding; this course covers mandatory binding arbitration. Arbitration is an integral part of the practice of law for both litigators and transactional lawyers.

title: Arch Cultures of N America
description: Cultural developments of North American Indians (Canada, U.S., and northern Mexico) before Columbus.

title: Archaeological Fieldwork in NE
description: Archaeological fieldwork and corresponding field school activities in the Near East.

title: Archaeological Method Theory
description: Field and analytic methods and their relevance to data acquisition; use of theory and the relation of theory to methods.

title: Archaeological Science
description: Uses of technologically sophisticated scientific techniques in archaeology to analyze the elemental composition or age of artifacts. Relevance of these analyses to substantive archaeological problems.

title: Archaeology and the Bible
description: Setting and context of the Bible as clarified and supplemented from archaeology, history, and related studies. Archaeological methods.

title: Archaeology Field Trip
description: Field trip to archaeological sites in Utah and the Four Corners region.

title: Archaeology of Egypt
description: Survey of the most important archaeological sites, artifacts, and monuments of Egypt, their cultural contexts, as well as major methodological developments in Egyptian archaeology and Egyptology.

title: Archaeology of Europe
description: Cultural developments of temperate Europe from prehistory to the Roman expansion; lectures and case studies highlight issues related to environmental change, the introduction of farming, population movement, and the emergence of increasingly complex socio-economic systems.

title: Archaeology of Islam
description: Pre-Islamic roots through Ottoman period.  Sites, artifacts, and monuments of Islam.  Focus on religious and cultural contexts.  Relevant Islamic texts and archaeological methods for understanding medieval Islamic sites and artifacts.

title: Arch of Roman Civilization
description: \tSurvey of the most important sites, artifacts, monuments, and methodological approaches associated with the archaeological study of Etruria, Roman Italy, and the Roman Empire. Cultural contexts of the regions impacted by Roman civilization. \t

title: Arch of Ancient Aegean&Greece
description: Bronze Age Aegean through the Classical and Hellenistic eras. Archaeological sites, artifacts, and monuments of the Mediterranean region impacted by Greek civilization. Classical archaeological methodologies associated with the study, excavation, and interpretation of these cultures.

title: Area Studies
description: Literature, philosophy, and/or the arts of a particular geographical area.  Topics vary.

title: German Art and Architecture
description: Familiarizing students with the historical styles and the tools of analysis necessary for experiencing the art and architecture of German-speaking Europe. Students will visit churches, museums, palaces, and other important cultural sites.

title: Art Curr,Assessmnt,Mthds K-12
description: Art and design curriculum development and assessment methods for K-12 educators.

title: Art Ed: Issues & Trends
description: Seminar topics emphasizing issues and trends in art education. Topics investigated, discussed, and evaluated, depending on student needs.

title: Art Education Studio
description: MA courses in ceramics, drawing, figure drawing, oil painting, aqueous painting, printmaking, crafts, sculpture, digital art, and conceptual art media.

title: Art for Elementary Teachers
description: Preservice preparation designed to help art educators and elementary classroom teachers understand the visual arts and develop skills necessary for implementing an arts integrated approach for art education.

title: Art Framing
description: Introduction to the basic techniques, history, and aesthetics of art preparation and presentation, including the preparation of supports, frames, and other exhibition materials.

title: Art History Business Capstone
description: Professional fields associated with Art History. Topics include the museum, the commercial gallery, conservation and technical art history, art law, ethics, connoisseurship, government organizations, art organizations and auction houses, and challenges and opportunities within the field. Requires at least one intensive learning experience beyond the classroom.

title: Art Theory Languag
description: Review and critique of major theoretical approaches in art history, emphasizing  the recent interest in language and semiotics.

title: Art Theory Spectat
description: Review and critique of major theoretical approaches in art history,  emphasizing the philosophical relationship between viewer and object.

title: Art of Teaching Children Music
description: Overview and practical application of classroom general music methodologies in the elementary grades, including the relationship of classroom practice to choral and instrumental experiences.  Observation and teaching opportunities in the schools.

title: Art of Teaching Instrumental
description: Curriculum design, evaluating ensemble performance, advanced rehearsal techniques, administering secondary instrumental music programs; computers and computer-assisted instruction.

title: Art of Teaching Vocalists
description: Curriculum design, score analysis and preparation, choral arranging, rehearsal techniques, survey of literature, and vocal pedagogy, including treble voice and changing voice; computers and computer-assisted instruction.

title: Art of the Medieval West
description: Art in western Europe from 400 AD to 1400.

title: Art Education Student Teaching
description: Capstone, field-based, semester-long experience in teaching elementary and secondary students; demonstrating proficiency in all program standards. Seminar required.

title: Arthurian Lit
description: History and development of Arthurian theme.

title: Articulating Science
description: Identifying open scientific questions and crafting written proposals describing context, impact, and detailed experimental research plans.  Also, learning to critically evaluate the scientific writing of others.

title: AI in Business Operations
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) can impact business operations in substantial ways. This course provides students who do not have a technical (i.e., software engineering) background with a working knowledge of AI concepts, principles, tools, and applications. We review current types of AI systems and considerations for implementation. The course will prepare students to use AI on the job as well as direct others who manage the technical aspects of AI systems.

title: Arts Administration Capstone
description: Final course in BA in Art, Arts Administration track. Topics include various types of arts organizations, applying accounting and nonprofit management principles to arts administration, and professional opportunities in arts administration.

title: Arts and Letters
description: Not a valid course. Only to be used to apply credits to General Education requirements.

title: Arts Integration
description: Introduction to the integration of arts in education. Per Utah State Board of Education guidelines for the Arts Integration Endorsement, this course will give students training in implementation of Arts Integration in the classroom as well as in leadership and advocacy for the integration of arts in education.

title: ASC Competition
description: A culminating experience, emphasizing the application of knowledge and skills gained through students' undergraduate careers. Students participate in an industry-sponsored competition organized by the Associated Schools of Construction (ASC).  Preparation for, and participation in the competition deepens an understanding of real-world challenges toward solution-finding in the built environment.

title: Asian Culture
description: Literature, philosophy, and/or the arts in Asian culture.

title: Asian Lit Traditns
description: Comparative analysis of Asian literary works spanning several traditions.

title: Asian Lit Trads
description: Comparative analysis of Asian literary works spanning several traditions.

title: Asian Studies Abroad
description: Preparatory course approved for Asian Seminar (Study Abroad).

title: ASL Fingerspelling & Numbering
description: Develop ASL fingerspelling skills. Comprehend and produce accurate ASL numbers.

title: ASL Special Topics
description: Exploration of special topics in ASL and/or Deaf Culture to increase signing proficiency and content knowledge.

title: Asphalt Mixture Design
description: Properties and testing of asphalt mixtures and constituent materials; asphalt mixture design and analysis; asphalt construction practices; laboratory experimentation

title: Assessing Language & Culture
description: Methods of assessing language and culture learning, including the development of tests, questionnaires, portfolios, self- and peer-assessments, rubrics, and checklists.

title: Assessing Language Skills
description: Purposes and uses of various forms of assessment; development of tests, surveys, questionnaires, and alternative forms of assessment; evaluation of the quality of assessments.

title: Assessing Learning Outcomes
description: Selecting and constructing instruments and procedures for assessing affective, behavioral, and cognitive outcomes of education.

title: Assess'g Ling Diverse Students
description: Fundamental concepts in testing, use/interpretation of current instruments for language/academic assessment, appropriate placement of linguistically diverse students, and developing classroom language assessments.

title: Assessment in ECE
description: Formal and informal assessment strategies and data collection procedures for evaluating children's progress; programs to enhance learning, individualize instruction, and communicate with others.

title: Assessment & Diagnosis
description: Performing evaluations and determining how assessment informs clinical decision making and intervention in communication disorders.

title: Assess/Eval Stdnts w/Excp Nds
description: Teacher candidates will be determining present levels of performance, classifying students for special education services, and writing goals and objectives for IEP development.  Application of course concepts will occur in a local school district each week.  \n

title: Assessment & the TR Process
description: Gaining knowledge and ability in client assessment, theory-based and evidence-based treatment/program planning, and program/outcome evaluation.

title: Assessment in Gifted Education
description: This is a graduate course designed to provide educators with background and techniques for identifying and evaluating high ability and gifted students. Students will utilize multiple types of gifted and talented assessment tools to identify gifted students.

title: Assessment of ELLs
description: Major concepts, principles, theories, and research relating to assessing English as a second language and English language learners (ELLs); using appropriate measurement tools in evaluating ELLs' performance in placement, proficiency, and instruction.

title: Assessment of Learning
description: Strengthen understanding of high-school mathematics, with an emphasis on transformational geometry and trigonometry, in the context of creating and critiquing formative and summative assessments that support students' development of both conceptual understanding and procedural fluency.

title: Assistant Directing
description: Assisting directors for departmental productions.

title: Asst Tech for Stdnts w/Disab
description: Principles and applications in using assistive technology to improve the education and communication skills of students with disabilities.

title: APM Experience
description: Direct, practical, mentored, professional experience embedded in a product management team.

title: APM Lab
description: Develop and strengthen product management skills through active product management team involvement.

title: APM Lecture Series
description: Lectures and networking with product management professionals in a smaller setting to help students develop strategies to pursue careers in product management within a larger organization.

title: Asylum
description: Developing an in-depth understanding and practical knowledge of the procedures, substantive requirements, and best practices relating to representing foreign-born clients seeking protection in the United States from persecution abroad based on race, religion, nationality, membership in a particular social group, or political opinion.

title: Athletic Admin Internship
description: Development of professional skills in athletics administration: Logistics, event planning, marketing, social media.

title: AT Capstone
description: Synthesizing and integrating classroom and clinical experiences in preparation for BOC exam resulting in certification of athletic training students.

title: Clinical 1
description: Laboratory and field experience. First of four Athletic Training specialization and clinical  experiences (internships).

title: Clinical 2
description: Laboratory and field experience. Second of four Athletic Training specialization and clinical expectations experiences (internships).

title: Clinical 3
description: Laboratory and field experience. Third of four Athletic Training specialization and clinical expectations experiences (internships).

title: Clinical 4
description: Laboratory and field experience. Fourth of four Athletic Training specialization and clinical expectations experiences (internships).  Prepares students to practice as certified athletic trainers.

title: AT Internship
description: Additional credit hours or fifth semester for athletic training clinical education experience or immersive internship experience for MAT students.  Each credit of internship will require 160 hours of work.

title: Attic Orators
description: In-depth study of the prose of the 5th-4th century Athenian orators.

title: Audio Applications 1
description: Advanced concepts in digital sound editing.

title: Audio Applications 2
description: Advanced concepts in digital sound editing.

title: Auditions
description: Auditions, cold reading, resumes, and the business end of acting, music, and dance for the professional performer.

title: Augmentative & Alternative
description: Assessment and treatment of persons with severe communication difficulties who need augmentative or alternative means of communicating.

title: Aural Rehabilitation
description: Basic principles of hearing assessment and aural rehabilitation in children from birth to eight years.

title: Aural Skills 1
description: Development of aural skills through melodic dictation, rhythm dictation, and error detection; listening materials include diatonic melodies in major and minor keys and basic rhythms in simple and compound meters.

title: Aural Skills 2
description: Continued development of aural skills through melodic dictation, rhythm dictation, harmonic dictation, and error detection; listening materials include longer, arpeggiated melodies, more advanced rhythms, and diatonic harmonic progressions.

title: Aural Skills 3
description: Continued development of aural skills through melodic dictation, rhythm dictation, harmonic dictation, and error detection; listening materials include modal and chromatic melodies, more difficult rhythms, and chromatic chord progressions.

title: Aural Skills 4
description: Continued development of aural skills through melodic dictation, rhythm dictation, harmonic dictation, and error detection; listening materials include chromatic, modulating, and post-tonal melodies, challenging rhythms, and modulating chord progressions.

title: Authentic Leadership
description: Developing personal character and skills necessary to become an effective and authentic leader.

title: Author Studies
description: In-depth study of one author's corpus and its attendant contexts, ideas, history, criticism, and scholarly discourse.

title: Author Studies
description: Major authors from a variety of critical perspectives.

title: Autism Spectrum Disorders
description: Overview of characteristics, etiology, and prevalence of Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD); teaches strategies and skills supporting children's learning and daily functioning; review of instruction strategies, classroom organization, and teaming with families and professionals.

title: Autonomous Aircraft
description: Dynamics of fixed-wing aircraft flight, stability, and control derivatives, longitudinal and lateral control design; state-space control strategies for aircraft; and autonomous aircraft applications.

title: Autonomous Aircraft
description: Dynamics of fixed-wing aircraft fight, stability, and control derivatives, longitudinal and lateral control design; state-space control strategies for aircraft; and autonomous aircraft applications.

title: Autonomous Aircraft
description: Dynamics of fixed-wing aircraft flight, stability, and control derivatives, longitudinal and lateral control design; state-space control strategies for aircraft; and autonomous aircraft applications.

title: BA Exit Portfolio
description: Preparation and submission of all required materials for BA exit portfolio. Preparation for continued art practice after graduation.

title: BA Music Capstone
description: Mentored capstone project for students pursuing the Bachelor of Arts in Music degree. Students will pursue original research or creative work under the advisement of a faculty mentor.

title: BGS Capstone
description: Culminating course required for bachelor of general studies degree: analyze and evaluate BGS experience in light of the "Aims of a BYU Education" and summarize this experience in a reflective paper, integrate material learned in emphasis by completing a scholarly essay, and demonstrate accomplishment of learning outcomes.

title: Backpack Journalism
description: Mobile media production, including field reporting, editing, and distributing news for multiple platforms.

title: Bacteria-Host Interactions
description: Bacterial and host functions that facilitate colonization in pathogenic and symbiotic systems.

title: Bacterial Genetics
description: How DNA governs complex bacterial functions. Classical and modern approaches to gene discovery, including genetic screens, gene mapping, targeted genetic manipulations, and analyzing gene activity.

title: Bacterial Genomics
description: Practical training in computational analysis of bacterial genomic data, including genome assembly, comparative genomics, and statistical genomic analyses. Students will summarize their results in the form of a scientific publication.

title: Bacterial Pathogenesis Lab
description: Laboratory investigation of processes of bacterial pathogenesis.

title: Bacterial Pathogenesis
description: Fundamental principles of bacterial pathogenesis, emphasizing the molecular interactions of medically important bacteria and their hosts.

title: Badminton
description: Skills and strategies of badminton. Rules, strategies, and scoring in badminton are taught along with the following skills: clear, smash, grip, drive, and drop shots; low, high, drive, and flick serves.

title: Balinese Gamelan
description: Playing and performing on the Balinese gamelan (percussion) instruments.

title: Balinese Gamelan
description: Playing and performing on the Balinese gamelan (percussion) instruments.

title: Ballard Brief
description: Write a Ballard Brief intended for publication. The Ballard Brief should reflect deep research and excellent writing on a social impact topic of wide concern to inform the general public on key issues and interventions.

title: Ballet Accelerated Technique 1
description: Foundation in ballet technique.

title: Ballet Choreography
description: Fundamental choreographic structure emphasizing visual, kinesthetic, and musical aspects in ballet. Exploration of the choreographic process through theoretical study and analysis as well as practical application in the presentation of choreographic work. Concepts include clarity, creativity, transition, musical accent and phrasing, dynamic structure, form, stylistic coherence, artistic merit.

title: Ballet Pointe 1
description: Beginning level pointe technique.

title: Ballet Pointe 2
description: Intermediate level pointe technique

title: Ballet Pointe/Variations
description: Advanced Ballet pointe/variations.

title: Ballet Technique 2
description: Intermediate ballet technique.

title: Ballet Technique 3
description: Intermediate to advanced ballet technique.

title: Ballet Technique 4
description: Advanced ballet technique.

title: Ballet Technique 5
description: Advanced ballet technique with advanced pointe work for women and technique for men.

title: Ballet Technique, Men
description: Intermediate ballet technique for men.

title: Ballet, Beginning
description: Foundation in ballet technique.

title: Ballroom Dance Choreography
description: Choreography in Ballroom Dance emphasizing ensemble and partnership dancing.

title: Ballroom Dance Performance Co
description: Performance techniques and experience with BYU Ballroom Dance Company.

title: Ballroom Dance Performance Beg
description: Performance techniques and experience in ballroom dance.

title: Bllrm Dnc Performance Intrmd
description: Performance techniques and experience in ballroom dance.

title: Ballroom Dnc, Intl Beginning
description: Bronze level. Waltz, fox-trot, tango, quickstep.

title: Ballroom Dnce, Intl Tech 1
description: Silver level.  Waltz, fox-trot, tango, quickstep.

title: Ballroom Dnce, Intl Tech 2
description: Gold 1 level.  Waltz, tango, fox-trot, quickstep.

title: Ballroom Dnc, Intl Tech 3
description: Gold 2 level.  Waltz, fox-trot, tango, quickstep.

title: Ballroom Dnc, Intl Tech 4
description: Gold bar level:  waltz, tango, fox-trot, quickstep, Viennese waltz.

title: Band Literature
description: Concentrated study of band literature through analysis and conducting.

title: Banking Law
description: Review the laws affecting commercial banks and thrift institutions, the functions of the various federal and state regulatory agencies, the development of innovative forms of financial services, the effects of electronic technology upon banking law and interstate banking. Provides an overview of the different regulatory regimes affecting financial institutions (e.g., insurance companies, broker-dealers, investment banks, private funds, and depository institutions), with primary focus on banking law and regulation.

title: Bankruptcy
description: A practical course for lawyers who plan on representing businesses or individuals in today's economy. The relationship between debtors and creditors under both state debt collection law and bankruptcy law, with an emphasis on bankruptcy law. Bankruptcy issues from both a consumer and business perspective, covering bankruptcy and commercial principals.

title: Baroque Ensemble
description: Small ensemble that specializes in the performance of early music. Learning to play an authentic baroque instrument, mastering the period style of playing, and performing alongside students and faculty members. Includes rehearsals, performances, and listening assignments. In-depth study of early music to strengthen students as performers, musicians, and soloists on baroque and modern instruments.

title: Baroque Ensemble
description: Small ensemble that specializes in the performance of early music. Learning to play an authentic baroque instrument, mastering the period style of playing, and performing alongside students and faculty members. Includes rehearsals, performances, and listening assignments. In-depth study of early music to strengthen students as performers, musicians, and soloists on baroque and modern instruments.

title: Barre
description:
Barre is a high-energy program focusing on strength, flexibility, stamina and dynamic
stability. It is full body sculpting using the ballet barre and small, isometric, concentrated movementâ€”paying
particular attention to correct biomechanics of movement.

title: Basic Athletic Training
description: Recognition, evaluation, and care of athletic injuries. Techniques in taping, preventing, and rehabilitating injuries.

title: Basic Athletic Training Lab
description: Lab with techniques in preventing the injured through taping, wrapping, bracing and padding, and for treating and transporting injuries by splinting, wrapping, using ambulatory aids and spine boarding.

title: Basic Conc of Math
description: Concept-oriented exploration of number, measurement, and informal geometry in relation to children's learning.

title: Basic Conducting
description: Fundamental concepts and skills for nonmusic majors.

title: Basic Editing Skills
description: Editing theory and practice, emphasizing copyediting and basic line editing.

title: Basic Guitar Skill
description: Class instruction in guitar for nonmusic majors.

title: MLS Laboratory Operations
description: Basic laboratory process and procedures.

title: Basic Media Production
description: Introduction to basics of film and video production. Includes lecture and practical lab experiences with audio and video.

title: Basic Mediation
description: Fundamental communication and mediation skills. Simulated exercises and role playing.

title: Basic Mediation
description: A skills‑based seminar that introduces conceptual knowledge and practical skills training for a mediator. Weekly instructional mediation training through interactive lecture, group discussion, role-play, video and demonstration. Basic mediation concepts such as communication skills, information gathering, managing conflict, identifying issues, active listening, reframing, problem solving, negotiating, and agreement writing. Skills will be practiced in class through role-play and in the community.

title: Basic Organ Skills
description: Class instruction in organ for nonmusic majors.

title: Basic Physics
description: Principles of classical and modern physics. Concepts and simple calculations applied to the world around us.

title: Basic Sewing Techniques
description: This course focuses on the basics of sewing techniques.

title: Pastoral Ministry
description: Focuses on the basic skills of pastoral counseling for those wishing to be full-time military chaplains. The emphasis is on pastoral skills in a military setting.

title: Basic Storyboarding
description: Introduction to visual storytelling and storyboarding in a collaborative setting.

title: Basic Training in TESOL
description: Basic preparation to teach English to speakers of other languages in particular settings.

title: Basic Vocal Skills
description: Class instruction in voice for nonmusic majors.

title: Basketball, Beginning
description: Beginning skills, rules, and strategies of basketball. Rules and scoring, ball handling, passing, lay-up shooting, jumpshots, free throw shooting, defensive strategies (zone/man), and offensive strategies (zone/man).

title: Basketball, Intermediate
description: Intermediate skills, rules, and strategies of basketball. Rules and scoring, ball handling, passing (chest/bounce), lay-up shooting, jumpshots, free throw shooting, defensive strategies (zone/man), and offensive strategies (zone/man).

title: Bassoon
description: Private or semiprivate instruction. One to two hours of daily practice

title: Bayesian Methods
description: Basic Bayesian inference; conjugate and nonconjugate analyses; Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods; hierarchical modeling; convergence diagnostics.

title: Bayesian Methods in C S
description: Applying Bayesian methods useful for incorporating confidence or belief into problems in computer science, allowing computers to better handle uncertainty.

title: Bayesian Reliability
description: Mathematics, distributions, management, and maintenance of basic reliability concepts; collection and analysis of test data; fault tree analysis; applying reliability in various areas.

title: Becoming a Disciple Leader
description: Capstone designed to help students discover leadership capabilities and develop ability to lead as a disciple of Jesus Christ. Application of principles of leadership and of the Gospel. Discover personal strengths, gifts, and missions, and develop skills and commitments essential for working with and through others to improve organizations of all kinds-families, Church, work, and communities.

title: Beginning Char Anim
description: Beginning three-dimensional animation with emphasis on the fundamental principles of timing, acting, performance, and overlapping action.

title: Beginning Chinese Reading
description: Chinese writing system, reading, and basic composition using Chinese characters.

title: Beginning Creative Processes
description: Foundational dance improvisation and choreography in a workshop setting.

title: Beginning Latin Accelerated
description: Equivalent of combined Latin 101, 102.

title: Beginning Mandarin
description: Basic grammar, vocabulary building, speaking.

title: Beginning Mandarin
description: Continuation of Chin 101.

title: Beg. Non-Fiction and New Media
description: Principles and techniques of new media production, information gathering, conceptualizing, and storytelling.

title: Beginning Piano Techniques 1
description: Class instruction in piano for nonmusic majors.

title: Beginning Piano Techniques 2
description: Continuation of Music 113.

title: Begin Practicum Mar&Fam Ther
description: Introductory course in the therapeutic process and skills. Experience in counseling individuals, premarital and marital dyads, families, groups of dyads, and multiple families.

title: Beginning Stage Combat
description: Basic hand-to-hand stage combat instruction. Introduction to tumbling and falls.

title: Behavioral Ecology
description: Students in Behavioral Ecology will study the biological mechanisms and evolutionary causes and consequences of a range of animal behaviors.  The course will be geared towards helping students to gain a broad perspective of the range of factors that influence animal behavior and to provide students with the tools conduct, evaluate, and understand research on the ecology of animal behavior.  We will cover a broad range of topics that are central to the field of behavioral ecology, including the economics of behavioral decisions, predator-prey arms races, resource competition, group living, reproductive selection and conflict, parental care, mating systems, social behaviors, cooperation and altruism, and communication.  Each of these topics will be examined from an evolutionary and ecological perspective, with a focus on helping students first to understand the underlying theory and concepts, and second to grasp the research techniques and approaches used to increase knowledge in this field.

title: Behavioral Economics
description: Examine the effects of social, cognitive, and emotional factors on the economic decisions of individuals and institutions.

title: Behavioral Neurobiology
description: Basic physiological, anatomical, and chemical foundations of psychology.

title: Behavioral Neuroscience
description: Critical examination of anatomical, physiological, and chemical bases of behavioral expression.

title: Best Practices in Amer Educ
description: Ideas, organizational arrangements, policies, and practices judged highly effective, especially in the promotion of student learning outcomes.   Includes visits to local schools.

title: Best Practices in Teacher Educ
description: Teacher education curriculum; theories and research that support current practice; improving that practice.

title: Project Implementation
description: Students complete an intensive project on a topic of their choosing which includes developing personal research and design methods, a project implementation, and a public exhibition.

title: BFA Capstone Project: Research
description: Students will develop personal research and design methods to aid in the completion of a capstone project of their choosing.

title: BFA Capstone: Discovery
description: Students explore ideas towards completing an intensive project on a topic of their choosing which includes developing personal research and design methods, a project implementation, and a public exhibition.

title: BFA Project: Research
description: Students will complete an intensive project on a topic of their choice, develop personal research and design methods to prepare the project for public exhibition.

title: BFA Final Project
description: Advanced individual project with minimum guidance, showing high degree of competence within chosen major.

title: BFA Final Project
description: Advanced individual project with minimum guidance, showing high degree of competence within chosen major.

title: BFA Final Project & Exit Portf
description: Final exhibition and project report; completed travel requirement account; submit all required materials for BFA exit portfolio.

title: Capstone Project: Implem.
description: Students will carry out an intensive capstone project based on a topic of their choosing.  Students' topic will be based on student-driven market specific research and future focus, and implementation includes planning, and exhibition of completed artwork.

title: ILL Capstone Project: Research
description: Students develop research in connection with their Illustration BFA capstone project, including both subject and market-based research on an individual project.

title: BFA Independent Film Productn
description: Advanced individual animation project with minimum guidance, showing a high degree of competence.

title: BFA Capstone Project
description: Students complete an advanced individual project in photography on a topic of their choosing which includes developing personal research, project implementation, and a public exhibition.

title: BFA Senior Showcase
description: Participation in a BFA performance group culminating in a showcase for agents and directors in New York City during April.

title: Bidding & Estimating
description: Competitive bidding strategies, quantity takeoffs, bid analyses for construction and maintenance in the plant and landscape systems industry.

title: Bilingual Assessment
description: Assessment and educational intervention for children from non-English-language and other diverse backgrounds. Utilizing nonverbal and alternative forms of assessment.

title: Biliteracy Development in DLI
description: Integration of theory, research-based best practices, and instructional strategies to support teachers in developing, scaffolding, differentiating, and assessing literacy learning for language majority and minority students in dual language immersion contexts.

title: Molecular Evolution
description: Theoretical foundations of molecular evolution; molecular phylogenetics, estimates of population genetic parameters, gene duplication, horizontal gene transfer, rates of evolution, molecular clocks.

title: Bio-Innovation 1
description: Students work as a team of consultants for external client life sciences tech companies. Students will develop the materials, strategy, organization, and rationale for successfully attracting investor capital to that business. At the end of the semester, students will know how create and grow a business around an existing foundation technology.

title: Bio-Innovation 2
description: Students, as small teams, will search for and validate life sciences technologies or ideas as a potential platform technology on which to form a new business enterprise. At the end of the semester, students will know where new technologies come from and how to assess their potential commercial value.

title: Genomics
description: Current analysis of genes and genomes; computational approaches for interpreting genomic data, including genome sequencing and annotation, gene expression and the transcriptome, functional genomics, metagenomics, and genetic variation and SNPs.

title: Biochemical Engineering
description: Applying chemical engineering principles to biochemical systems.

title: Biochem Methods
description: This course teaches basic laboratory skills and methods necessary for biochemistry research.

title: Biochemistry
description: First-semester biochemistry. Molecular components of cells, chemical structure and function, enzymes, metabolic transformations, photosynthesis.

title: Bioethics
description: In-depth lecture and small group discussion of varied bioethical issues. LDS Church positions emphasized when appropriate.

title: Biogeochem
description: We will explore the fundamental principles of biogeochemistry, focusing on cycles of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur in aquatic, terrestrial, and atmospheric systems. Special attention will be given to the microbial-mediated transformations of nutrients, organic pollutants, and heavy metals, and the impact of human disturbances in natural and urbanizing soils and water.

title: Biogeochem Lab
description: Field, laboratory, and statistical techniques investigating the fundamental principles of biogeochemistry, focusing on cycles of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, and sulfur in aquatic, terrestrial, and atmospheric systems. Special attention will be given to the microbial-mediated transformations of nutrients, organic pollutants, and heavy metals, and the impact of human disturbances in natural and urbanizing soils and water.

title: Biogeography
description: Broad-scale distribution of plants and animals.  Theoretical and practical applications to conservation and effects of global environmental change.

title: Bioinformatics
description: Independent student research under faculty supervision.

title: Bioinformatics Algorithms
description: In this course, students learn theory and concepts of bioinformatics algorithms that are used in the field. They gain experience implementing these algorithms and applying them. These algorithms are used in diverse biological disciplines, including genome assembly, phylogenetics, multiple sequence alignment, next-generation sequencing read mapping, gene-expression analysis, and mass-spectrometry analysis.

title: Bioinf & Data Analysis
description: Bioinformatics skills have become critical for biological research. This course is intended to introduce students to bioinformatics. Students will be introduced to the Linux operating system and gain skills in employing it in research. They will also learn computer-programming skills using the Python language. Students will acquire the skills to perform data manipulations and simple analyses on biological datasets.

title: Biological Anthropology
description: Relationships between human biology, environment, social structure, and culture. Concepts and data on race, primates, evolution, population genetics, growth, and sociobiology.

title: Biological Electron Microscopy
description: Theoretical and practical aspects of transmission and scanning electron microscopy of biological samples.

title: Biological Basis of Behavior
description: Biological basis of human behavior: relationship between neurological processes and behavior; medications used in treating various disorders.

title: Biological Data Science
description: Students will learn concepts and theory of data-science techniques applied to diverse types of biological data. These techniques include statistical methods, visualization, predictive analytics, and other computer-intensive methods.

title: Biological Diversity: Animals
description: Comparative organization and evolutionary significance of morphological, physiological, reproductive, and ecological differences in invertebrates and vertebrates.  Laboratory included.

title: Biological Diversity: Plants
description: Comparative organization and evolutionary significance of morphological, physiological, reproductive, and ecological differences in fungi, algae, and principal groups of land plants.  Laboratory included.

title: Biological Fndtns of Human Dev
description: Biological, genetic, and neurological foundations of human development and their interactions with family socialization processes.

title: Biological Science Education
description: Topics include epistemology, pedagogy, innovative curriculum, and scientific education research.

title: Biological Systemat Curation
description: Principles, methods, and tools of taxonomy and systematics as applied to species delimitation, specimen-based research, nomenclatural codes, and the curation of biological specimens.

title: Biology
description: General biology course with laboratory for biology majors.  Introduction to disciplines in the life sciences including methods for scientific inquiry, biochemical dynamics, cell structure and function, evolutionary theory, bioenergetics, and ecological interactions.

title: Biology Student Teaching
description: Field-based, semester-long experience in teaching secondary students; demonstrating proficiency in all program standards.  Seminar (Sc Ed 490R) required.

title: Biomechanical Modeling
description: Learn to use advanced biomechanics software to model, analyze, and interpret human movement. Create models of the human skeleton from motion capture data, represent motion in three dimensions using Euler angles, and perform inverse dynamics.

title: Biomedical Engin Principles
description: Application of chemical engineering principles to model physiologic systems and to solve medical problems.

title: Biomedical Instrumentation
description: Biomedical instrumentation concepts including signal conditioning, pre-amplification, impedance matching, and transduction. Introduction to biomedical signal sources such as blood oxygenation, biopotentials, and free ion conductivity. Practical biomedical sensor design and construction.

title: Biometry & Experimental Design
description: The design, analysis, and interpretation of biological research using modern analytical tools and relevant software.

title: Biophysical Chemistry
description: Applications of physical chemistry to biological systems. Spectroscopic applications, computational methods, structural biochemistry, thermodynamics, equilibria, statistical mechanics, transport properties, kinetics, quantum mechanics.

title: Biostats/Epidemiology
description: Knowledge of basic epidemiological and biostatistical principles, concepts, and procedures for the surveillance and investigation of health-related states.

title: Blockchain
description: Investigation of market, regulatory, and enforcement challenges regarding private payment systems, cryptocurrencies, and other uses of blockchain technology.

title: Blockchain Technologies
description: Technical underpinnings of blockchain-based systems, including cryptocurrency, smart contracts, decentralized finance (De-Fi), and Web3. Explores which problems are suitable for a blockchain-based solution and discusses arguments in favor and against blockchain systems.

title: Body, Mind, Spirit
description: Sacredness of the body and its meaningfulness to the whole being. Comparative approach utilizing ideas from the restored gospel and Western and Eastern philosophy (nature of being).

title: Book and Publishing History
description: An introduction to book and publishing history, print culture, reception, and the materiality of both literary and non-literary texts.

title: Bookbinding
description: Traditional approaches to hand bookbinding.

title: Border Spanish
description: Mexican-American speech patterns, including language contact and bilingualism.

title: Borehole Geophysics & Geology
description: Applied well log analysis, including conventional and new techniques. Subsurface geology and lithology determined from many logs. Determining porosity, permeability, and fluid saturation with hydrology, and hydrocarbon applications.

title: Botany Science
description: In-service course for science teachers.

title: Bowling, Beginning
description: Beginning skills, rules, and scoring of bowling. Equipment, rules/scoring, grip/setup, approach/arm swing, strike targeting, straight ball, hook ball, and spare targeting.

title: Bowling, Intermediate
description: Demonstrate competence in the intermediate skills of bowling through class drills, practice, and competition.  Demonstrate an understanding of the rules, vocabulary, strategies, and scoring in bowling by passing a written exam.  Identify in a written exam the benefits of bowling as a physical activity and a source of life-long enjoyment.

title: Brand Management Strategy
description: Develop the fundamental skills required to successfully manage consumer brands, including brand strategy and development, P&L management, portfolio creation, AC Nielsen analysis, product innovation and competitive strategy.

title: Branding 1
description: Studio course in which students develop strategic, integrated brand systems, including trademarks, logos, corporate identity systems and their applications to a diverse range of products and media.

title: Branding 2
description: Advanced studio course that provides an in-depth study of branding, culminating in the creation of integrated branding systems, brand audits and brand guidelines.

title: Brass & Percussion
description: Private or semiprivate instruction. One to two hours of daily practice.

title: Brazil
description: From 1500 to present, emphasizing relationship between colonial patterns and twentieth-century reality and dilatory transformation of Brazil's political and economic culture.

title: Bridge Preservation
description: Classifications of bridge components and elements; bridge mechanics; selection, scheduling, and application of bridge preservation treatments.

title: Bridge Structures
description: Design of composite, continuous beam, and girder bridges, including piers, abutments, floor systems, and bearings; field trips to observe bridge construction and fabrication.

title: Brigham Capital
description: Team management of actual investment portfolio. Responsibility for identifying potential investments, modeling their financial value, and recommending portfolio actions.

title: British Fam Hist Research
description: Records, geographical-historical background, paleography, and methods for reconstruction of individual families and development of demographic and family history studies in England, Scotland, and Wales.

title: British Government & Politics
description: Examination of the origin and contemporary operation of British political institutions as they relate to British society.

title: British Literary History 1
description: Development of ideas, movements, genres, and styles in early English literature as illustrated through representative texts.

title: British Literary History 2
description: Development of ideas, movements, genres, and styles in later English literature as illustrated through representative texts.

title: British Literature after 1800
description: Representative writers, genres, and literary trends of British literature after 1800.

title: British Literature before 1800
description: Representative writers, genres, and literary trends of British literature before 1800.

title: Brit Liter in Cultural Setting
description: Survey of British literary history for London Centre programs. Introduction to a range of major authors and texts from the Elizabeth Age through the twenty-first century. Designed to instill knowledge of and appreciation for Britain's literary heritage and to provide practice interpreting literary texts and movements in light of the distinctive historical, geographic, and biographical insights that a study abroad experience affords.

title: Buddhism
description: Study selected figures, texts, and problems in the history of non-Western philosophy.

title: Building Your Lean Venture
description: Explores the tasks entrepreneurs must master once they have settled on a business model and are ready to launch their business, including team building and leadership, product development, operations/logistics, financial modeling, fundraising, marketing, sales, client on-boarding and success.\n

title: Bus Adm & Tech App
description: Organizing and managing business affairs in educational institutions. Business and instructional applications of technology in education.

title: Business Analytics
description: Skills business leaders need to make decisions based on data. Foundations of quantitative analysis necessary to understand the business analytics process.  Applying steps in the analytics process including identifying and articulating the business problem, gathering appropriate data, determining the proper analysis procedure, and summarizing/reporting the resulting findings.

title: Business Analytics
description: Introduction to both descriptive (data visualization) and predictive (forecasting) data analytics. Focus on using the analytical tools and skills needed to make better data-centered managerial decisions.

title: Bus & Acc Info Systems
description: Study of inputs, processing, outputs, and files of several transaction-processing subsystems.  Foundation for understanding internal control.  Variety of tools used to design, create, or document accounting information systems (AIS) to achieve organizational objectives.

title: Business & Ethics in Animation
description: Learning the practical and ethical side to the entertainment industry through readings and discussions as preparation for expectations as artists, leaders, and members of the Church.

title: Business & the Constitution
description: Examination of the myriad ways in which the federal Constitution limits federal and state governments' ability to interfere with business activity and empowers the federal government to facilitate such activity.

title: Business Arabic
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught.  Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Career Lecture Series
description: Lecture series exploring various business career alternatives.

title: Business Chinese
description: For experienced speakers of the language.  Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversing, reading, and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Chinese
description: Introduction to terminology and format of business communication in Chinese, emphasizing both reading and writing of various forms of business communication.

title: Business English
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Ethics
description: Basic issues, concepts, and tools of management ethics; includes ethical theory, character ethics, and social responsibility, all taught in a gospel context.

title: Business Ethics.
description: Basic issues, concepts, and tools of management ethics; includes ethical theory, behavioral ethics, character ethics, leadership ethics and corporate social responsibility, all taught in a gospel context.

title: Business Ethics for Lawyers
description: Examination of the theoretical and foundational roots of business ethics and business ethics issues that confront employees and managers of corporations and their lawyers.

title: Business Finance
description: Short-term financing of a business operation. Developing techniques for financial planning, such as analysis of ratios, profitability, and liquidity.

title: Business Finance
description: Short-term financing of a business operation.  Developing techniques for financial planning, such as analysis of ratios, profitability, and liquidity.

title: Business Finance
description: Introduction to capital procurement, capital deployment and capital distribution. Focus is on making managerial decisions that add value to the firm.

title: Business French
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business German
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Information Systems
description: Create technology solutions to solve business problems. Learn database, analytics, automation, and programming skills useful to all business majors.

title: Business Italian
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught.  Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Japanese
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Korean
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Language
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught.  Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Law
description: Introduction to legal principles and institutions affecting business.

title: Business Model Validation
description: Create a successful new venture by validating an initial idea and subsequent business model.

title: Business Negotiations
description: Skills of negotiation in a wide variety of professional settings.  Promoting negotiation's pervasive role in shaping business outcomes, particularly in buyer-seller interactions.

title: Business of Editing/Publishing
description: The purpose of this course is to better prepare you for the business side of editing and publishing careers. You'll develop skills that are complementary to editing, such as in using advanced features of software programs, marketing publications, calculating financial information, managing projects, and increasing productivity.

title: Business Organizations
description: Introduction to business associations, agency, uniform partnership acts, the essentials of corporate formation, shareholders rights, special problems of closely held businesses, preemptive rights, etc.

title: Business Plan Competition Mgt
description: Directors of the BYU Business Plan Competition learn and apply skills in leadership, governance, financial management, mentoring, and VA/Angel networking.  application and faculty approval required.

title: Business Portuguese
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Practices for Artists
description: The business of being an artist, exploring career options, alternative applications, interdisciplinary opportunities, and requisite preparation for career readiness.

title: Spreadsheet Automation
description: Programming in Excel Visual Basic; automating common tasks; retrieving data from web servers; building optimization models and user forms.

title: Business Reorganization
description: A practical analysis of the law and policy underlying business reorganizations in Chapter 11: from filing of the petition to the confirmation of the plan.

title: Business Russian
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Spanish
description: For experienced speakers of the language being taught. Emphasizes business concepts; practice and case study including conversation, reading,and presenting, while enriching business vocabulary.

title: Business Strategy
description: Introduction to strategic planning; concepts, models, and analysis.

title: Business to Business Selling
description: A practical approach to direct business-to-business selling, specifically focused on obtaining new customers with a secondary focus on cross-selling into existing customers.

title: Business-to-Business Marketing
description: Examining the scope and challenges of business-to-business markets, including building and managing customer relationships and services, customer selection, B2B distribution channels, managing R&D and technical product development, new-product launch, positioning, and pricing.

title: BYU Foundations
description: UNIV 101 focuses on the mission and aims of a BYU education, the balanced development of the total person, the purposes of a university education, preparing for a life of service, and making the transition to life as a BYU student. Topics include but are not limited to: becoming a Christ-centered disciple-scholar, service, managing expectations, relationships with faculty, healthy mindsets, belonging, working with diverse ideas and opinions, and planning next steps.

title: BYU MOA Internship
description: Professional training in curatorial practices within the BYU Museum of Art.

title: BYU Studio Orchestra
description: Patterned after professional recording ensembles, the studio orchestra will give students the experience of participating in real world recording scenarios. Students in this exciting new ensemble with learn a variety of skills such as improved sight reading, playing in multiple genres and styles, syncing to a click track, understanding modern recording procedures and practices, and playing to picture.

title: Business Career Essentials
description: Introduction for science, math, and statistics majors to careers in industry. Project planning, oral and written business presentations, business accounting, and technology readiness.

title: Calculus 1
description: Differential and integral calculus: limits; continuity; the derivative and applications; extrema; the definite integral; fundamental theorem of calculus; L'Hopital's rule.

title: Calculus 2
description: Techniques and applications of integration; sequences, series, convergence tests, power series; parametric equations; polar coordinates.

title: Calculus of Several Variables
description: Partial differentiation, the Jacobian matrix, and integral theorems of vector calculus.

title: Calculus Teaching & Learning
description: Fundamental calculus concepts as well as the curricula, reform efforts, and research associated with teaching and learning calculus.

title: Camoes
description: Critical study of the works of Portuguese poet Luis Vaz de Camoes.

title: Campaigns & Elections
description: Analyzes electoral process in the United States, including history, significance in governance, campaign strategy, finance, media role, etc.

title: Canadian Govt & Politics
description: Growth and development of Canada and its government; Canada's role in the contemporary world

title: Capital & Security Markets
description: Analyzing the instruments of capital markets and incentives/risks of major market participants.  Understanding the structure and market acceptance of bank debt, short term debt alternatives, straight debt, equity linked debt, various forms of preferred equity, and international placements.  Solving risk management problems using swap overlays, embedded options, and other financial structures.

title: Capital Markets Academy
description: Teams work on live, market-sensitive projects for financial services, including private equity, private wealth, insurance companies, and asset management.

title: Capstone 1
description: Culminating experience based on skills learned in advanced technical courses. Students work in teams to plan, design, test, and demonstrate a major project.

title: Capstone 2
description: The second semester of a culminating experience based on skills learned in advanced technical courses. Students work in teams to plan, design, test, and demonstrate a major project.

title: Capstone Arabic
description: Readings in Arabic texts supporting research for the MESA capstone seminar.

title: Capstone Clinical Methods
description: Students will engage in guided clinical observations to learn practical clinical methods in the field of audiology and speech language pathology. Students will also become proficient in understanding and applying the ASHA Code of Ethics, and will learn basic professional writing skills.

title: Capstone Course in Portuguese
description: Culminating experience in which students assemble a portfolio demonstrating and reflecting on their learning as a Portuguese major and their goals for continued language use and improvement.

title: Capstone Course in Spanish
description: Culminating experience in which students assemble a portfolio demonstrating and reflecting on their learning as a Spanish major and their goals for continued language use and improvement.

title: Capstone Design 1
description: First semester of a two-semester design experience from conception to manufacturing planning and prototype. Product development process. Economic and manufacturing considerations. Intellectual property agreement required.

title: Capstone Design 2
description: Second semester of a two-semester design experience from conception to manufacturing planning and prototype. Product development process. Economic and manufacturing considerations. Intellectual property agreement required.

title: Capstone Exper in Athletic Trn
description: Synthesizing and integrating student classroom and clinical experiences in preparation for BOC examination resulting in certification of allied health professionals.

title: Capstone Experience
description: Capstone undergraduate research experience. A maximum of 6 credits can be taken across multiple semesters/terms. Only 3 credits can count towards elective requirements for a chemistry/biochemistry degree.

title: Capstone in Asian Studies
description: Learning research and writing skills necessary to prepare and present major senior research paper.

title: Capstone in Biodiversity & Con
description: Students will apply principles of biodiversity and conservation to complete a complex project that integrates their disciplinary understanding to address a broad issue in conservation or biodiversity research. This culminating experience will allow students to create a project that will facilitate their transition into a post baccalaureate environment.

title: Capstone in Bioinformatics
description: Students will apply principles of bioinformatics to complete a complex project that integrates their disciplinary understanding to address a broad, integrative computational problem. This culminating experience will allow students to create a project that will facilitate their transition into a post baccalaureate environment.

title: Capstone in Dance
description: Senior capstone project in dance. Project approval required.

title: Capstone Scandinavian Studies
description: Capstone course for the Scandinavian Studies minor. Mentored research in an area of interest in Scandinavia leading to a senior capstone project and presentation.

title: Capstone Internship
description: Cooperative education and related facility and property management on-the-job work experience. Project report required for IFMA Facility Management Professional (FMP) designation.

title: Capstone Paper
description: Submission in the portfolio of best capstone paper on a German-related topic.

title: Capstone in Applied Phscs
description: Conduct and report original research or appropriate creative work. Mentored career experience combining physics and the chosen area of interest.

title: Capstone Research Seminar
description: Research seminar; critical, analytical, and writing skills in preparation of a senior thesis.

title: Capstone Sem: Ind w/Disab
description: Synthesis of knowledge and skills in special education; development of professional ethics and commitment to professional development.

title: Capstone: Anim. Analysis
description: Review of current work for the capstone projects

title: Carbohydrates
description: Sugars, higher saccharides, starches, pectins, gums, hemicelluloses, celluloses, and their derivatives and their functions and reactions in foods.

title: Cardio Fitness
description: Cardio Fitness is an individualized dynamic fitness program designed to bring about an increase in total body fitness for participants of all levels of condition, ability, and needs.

title: Career Development
description: Students will complete a series of modules on various topics related to career development.

title: Career Development
description: Develop and fine-tune career management skills at an MBA level. Learn tools for strengthening personal brand, job search, and technological tools.

title: Career Dev/Assess
description: Theories of career development in lifespan and career counseling. Assessing interests, values, and other characteristics related to career decision making.

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.\n

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.

title: Career Development
description: Introduction to the resources, services, and opportunities for career development available to business management majors. Specific projects include developing a career plan, refining interviewing and networking skills, and interacting individually with a mentor well-established in a directly relevant career.

title: Career Exploration
description: Applying theories of individual, academic, and career development to the university student. Exploring university opportunities and college majors; graduation planning.

title: Career Exploration
description: Provides students the opportunity to explore careers in the public and nonprofit sectors, with specific opportunities to hear from and interact with professionals in the field and participate in mentoring activities.

title: Career Explorations in Ling.
description: Investigation of careers available with linguistics BA. Emphasis on planning one's major. Students should take this course early in their major.

title: Career Pathways Seminar
