It also embeds the role of advocacy by incorporating social networking and mobilization, interpersonal communication and negotiation, as well as the use of earned media and social platforms for generating public discourse.

title: Health Economics
description: Economic models of health-care markets, including the supply and demand for health and health care, insurance, market imperfections, public-sector involvement, and regulation.

title: Health Law and Policy
description: An interdisciplinary introduction to the largest industry in the United States, the health care industry.  Subjects to be covered include health care regulatory law (EMTALA, HIPAA, ERISA, Medicare, Medicaid), health care policy with emphasis on access to health care, and how to advocate for health care consumers.

title: Health Professions Application
description: Preparation for health professional school applications including medicine, dentistry, physical therapy, physician assistant, etc.; entire application process, including school identification and submission.

title: Health Professions Internship
description: Internships with health care providers or service delivery experience.

title: Program Planning Capstone
description: Introduction to needs assessment, program development, implementation, and evaluation in health promotion and public health.

title: Health Promotion Practicum
description: Field experience for health promotion graduate students (required); 50 hours of service in approved organization required per credit hour. Graduate students in other emphases may take this class with instructor's consent.

title: Health Psychology
description: In-depth examination of behavior from perspective of health and disease

title: Public Health & Primary Care
description: HLTH495 is a combination of a lecture and an experiential-based capstone class that serves as the culminating course for public health students in the Health Science Emphasis. The course is intended to provide  students with the opportunity to partner with the community in addressing real health issues that can benefit from a joint public health-primary care approach in addressing the social determinants of health.

title: Hlth, Disease & Determinants 1
description: An introduction to human health, disease, mental health, and injury and how biological, behavioral, socio-economic, and environmental factors impact health and contribute to health disparities, discussed from a population-wide approach integrating social and behavioral models and theories, descriptive epidemiology, and disease pathophysiology.

title: Hlth, Disease & Determinants 2
description: Persistent, emerging, and re-emerging population health problems and how evidence-based prevention and control strategies are applied in public health settings. Aims to expand on students' cumulative understanding of the descriptive epidemiology and pathophysiology of disease, injury, and mental health learned in HLTH 314. Origins of health disparities, and how social and behavioral sciences can contribute to providing effective intervention strategies. \n\n

title: Healthcare Delivery Management
description: An overview of healthcare delivery management for healthcare providers. Comprises a broad study of the various components within the healthcare industry including, but not limited to, healthcare services delivery, benchmarking principles, best practices, peer review, risk management, process improvement, performance improvement, measurement tools, utilization, case management, technology assessment, and decision support.

title: Healthcare Delivery Management
description: An overview of healthcare delivery management for healthcare providers. Comprises a broad study of the various components within the healthcare industry.

title: Healthcare Ethics
description: Overview of ethical principles and theories, emphasizing role of ethics in a healthcare environment; instruction and practice in advanced oral and written communication skills.

title: Healthcare Finance
description: Exploration of the background, stakeholders, principles, and complexity of the U.S. healthcare payment system to give students insights into systems thinking, managerial concepts, market trends, and the overlay of government regulation and policy of a multi-trillion dollar industry.

title: Healthcare Finance
description: Exploration of the background, stakeholders, principles, and complexity of the U.S. healthcare payment system to give students insights into systems thinking, managerial concepts, market trends, and the overlay of government regulation and policy of a multi-trillion dollar industry.

title: Healthcare Finance
description: Utilizing fiscal accountability to provide quality cost-effective healthcare.

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare (e.g., accounting, data analytics, ethics, finance, human resources, information systems, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, strategy, supply chain management, and other specializations).

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare (e.g., accounting, data analytics, ethics, finance, human resources, information systems, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, strategy, supply chain management, and other specializations).

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare.

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare (e.g., accounting, data analytics, ethics, finance, human resources, information systems, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, strategy, supply chain management, and other specializations).

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare (e.g., accounting, data analytics, ethics, finance, human resources, information systems, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, strategy, supply chain management, and other specializations).

title: Healthcare Industry Dynamics
description: A broad study of the many interconnected components of the healthcare industry, including medical technology, pharmaceuticals, hospital administration, healthcare policy, insurance, public health, etc. Introductory applications of various functional skills to healthcare (e.g., accounting, data analytics, ethics, finance, human resources, information systems, marketing, operations, organizational behavior, strategy, supply chain management, and other specializations).

title: Healthcare Industry Research
description: An opportunity for students to collaborate with faculty, students, and industry partners around the world on healthcare research. Students will generate knowledge on relevant healthcareindustrytopics based on rigorous academic research partnered with industry leaders while increasing experiential learning and enhancing critical thinking and research skills.

title: Healthcare Industry Research
description: An opportunity for students to collaborate with faculty, students, and industry partners around the world on healthcare research. Students will generate knowledge on relevant healthcareindustrytopics based on rigorous academic research partnered with industry leaders while increasing experiential learning and enhancing critical thinking and research skills.

title: Healthcare Industry Research
description: An opportunity for students to collaborate with faculty, students, and industry partners around the world on healthcare research. Students will generate knowledge on relevant healthcareindustrytopics based on rigorous academic research partnered with industry leaders while increasing experiential learning and enhancing critical thinking and research skills.

title: Healthcare Internship
description: Provide students with real-world experience in local hospitals to prepare for careers in healthcare management.

title: Healthcare Law and Regulations
description: An overview of healthcare law needed to identify legal issues inherent in the healthcare industry. This includes a review of the many facets pertaining to the principles of law and ethics in the U.S. healthcare system including healthcare organizations, pharmaceutical and medical technology companies, health insurers, hospitals, healthcare providers, etc. These topics include, but are not limited to: patients' rights, privacy, security, liability, confidentiality, informed consent, licensing, healthcare reform, etc.

title: Healthcare Law and Regulations
description: An overview of healthcare law needed to identify legal issues inherent in the healthcare industry. This includes a review of the many facets pertaining to the principles of law and ethics in the U.S. healthcare system including healthcare organizations, pharmaceutical and medical technology companies, health insurers, hospitals, healthcare providers, etc.

title: Healthcare Leadership Lectures
description: Top executives share insights about the healthcare industry and related career opportunities.

title: Healthcare Leadership Lectures
description: Top executives share insights about the healthcare industry and related career opportunities.\n

title: Healthy Sexuality in Marriage
description: Understanding how healthy sexuality can be developed in marriage by surveying the relevant theories and research that are consistent with principles of the gospel. Students will be better able to facilitate health and growth in the families they work with as professionals and will be better prepared to navigate their own sexual feelings, thoughts, and behaviors in a way that is consistent with healthy relationship functioning and the doctrines of the gospel.

title: Hearing Science & Acoustics
description: Hearing anatomy, physiology, and science.

title: Hearing Tests & Measures
description: Theory and practice of auditory assessment.

title: Heat & Mass Transfer
description: Heat and mass transfer, including conduction, convection, radiation, diffusion; steady and unsteady state systems; transport analogies; design applications.

title: Heat Transfer
description: Conservation principles; Fundamentals of conduction, convection and radiation;  Problem solving

title: Hebrew Bible Studies
description: Current analytical  methods used in academic study and interpretation of the Hebrew Bible.

title: Hebrew Conversation
description: Daily practice speaking and understanding Modern Hebrew, beginning at the ACTFL intermediate-low level.

title: Hebrew Media
description: Emphasizes reading, aural comprehension, and speaking Hebrew. Includes newspaper reading, listening to local news on radio and television, and in-class discussion of current events.

title: Helping Relationships
description: Practicum in common factors in personal, professional, and volunteer helping relationships. Students explore and enhance their proficiency in therapeutic relationships, motivational interviewing, relationship mediation, and relationship systems conceptualization.

title: Hematology
description: The normal physiology of blood and the pathophysiology of anemias, leukemias, and coagulation disorders.

title: Hematology Laboratory
description: Training in medical laboratory hematology techniques and the diagnosis of hematological disorders.

title: Heritage & Cultural Tourism
description: Heritage and culture (places, people, relics, and traditions) as tourism resources examined within the context of supply and demand, conservation, interpretation, management, planning, and politics.

title: Heritage Resource Mgt
description: Legal and ethical issues for practicing archaeologists. Preservation law, collections law, public archaeology, Native American issues, and careers in archaeology and museums.

title: Herodotus
description: In-depth study of The Histories of Herodotus.

title: Herpetology
description: Reptile and amphibian evolution, systematics, morphology, distribution, and natural history. Lab emphasizes taxonomy, classification, and distribution of western U.S. species.

title: High Perform Computing
description: Explore GPU, multi-core and distributed architectures. Programming topics include forms of parallelism, decomposition, scaling issues, data locality, computation patterns, parallel libraries, languages, and performance analysis. Parallel application examples illustrate design principles and potential performance benefits.

title: Hiking
description:
Beginning introduction to principles of exercise and nutrition, safety, and principles
of hiking. Students will go on a variety of hikes within Utah County.

title: Hindu Philosophy
description: Study selected figures, texts, and problems in the history of non-Western philosophy.

title: Hispanic Cinema
description: Introduction to study of film; background in appreciating best of motion picture art in Spain and Spanish America.

title: Hispanic Cinema
description: Introduction to study of film; background in appreciating best of motion picture art in Spain and Spanish America.

title: Hispanic Dialectology
description: Overview of the varieties of spoken Spanish.

title: Hispanic Ling, Research Meth
description: Basic research fields in linguistics (i.e., phonology, philology, syntax, psycholinguistics), how research differs in each area, and specific theoretical issues associated with each. Bibliographical and field research methods and techniques of reporting findings.

title: Hispanic Theatre Production
description: Theory and practice of dramatic performance. Includes participation in play to be performed during semester.

title: Hisp Theatre Prod
description: Theory and practice of dramatic performance. Includes participation in play to be performed during semester.

title: Hispanic-American Short Story
description: Introduction and development of an important literary genre in Spanish America, including works of Jorge Luis Borges, Julio Cortazar, Juan Rulfo, Gabriel Garcia Marquez, etc.

title: Greek History
description: Political, economic, social, and intellectual history of Greece from Mycenaean times to the Hellenistic period.

title: Roman History
description: Political, economic, social, and intellectual history of Rome from the foundation of the city to Constantine.

title: Topics: Greek & Roman History
description: Study of the history of Greece and Rome through the examination of primary Greek and Latin historiographical texts and secondary scholarship. Topics vary.

title: Topics: Ancient Greek History
description: Study of the history of Greece through the examination of primary Greek historiographical texts and secondary scholarship. Topics vary.

title: Topics: Ancient Roman History
description: Study of the history of Rome through the examination of primary Latin historiographical texts and secondary scholarship. Topics vary.

title: Arab & Islamic Civilization
description: Social science/humanities core course covering Arab and Islamic civilization; historical evolution of Middle East to present. Overview of modern Palestinian society.

title: Jewish Civilization
description: Social science/humanities core course; broad introduction to Jewish self-understanding and history, focusing on relationships among people, faith, and land.

title: Hist & Social Foundations
description: Leaders, events, and trends in history of music education, emphasizing sociological implications.

title: Historical Anthropology
description: This course will develop students' understanding of the fundamentally historical dimensions of anthropology, both in terms of subject matter and execution. Skills students will acquire will include: expository and critical treatment of: ethnohistory; historical archaeology; primary and secondary historical research; time and temporality; myth and history; synchrony and diachrony; structure and agency; historiography; oral history; anthropology of history; and past making in different cultures and social groups.

title: Historical Anthropology
description: This course will develop students' understanding of the fundamentally historical dimensions of anthropology, both in terms of subject matter and execution. Students will be exposed to the central topics, debates, theories, and approaches of the specifically historical branches of anthropological research including expository and critical treatment of: ethnohistory; historical archaeology; primary and secondary historical research; time and temporality; myth and history; synchrony and diachrony; structure and agency; historiography; oral history; anthropology of history; and past making in different cultures and social groups.

title: Foundations of STEM Education
description: Historical and philosophical foundations of the STEM education disciplines, including socio-cultural, economic, and political influences.

title: Historical Geology
description: Developmental history of the earth, its landforms, and life forms, emphasizing the North American continent. Field trips and lab studies.

title: Historical Geology Lab
description: Applying fossils, rocks, stratigraphy, correlation, and geologic maps to interpret Earth's history.

title: US Historical Literacies
description: Historical literacy within the context of U.S. history; preparation of instructional materials and field experiences for elementary and secondary education students.

title: Hist Lit Theory
description: History and development of literary theory from classical world to present.

title: Russian Arts & Letters
description: A historical survey of Russian arts and letters, specifically visual arts, dance, music, theater, and film.

title: Historical-Comparative Ling
description: Learning theory and method of language change via comparing daughter languages and reconstructing ancestral languages. Language universals and typology.

title: History & Systems of Psych
description: Survey of the origins and development of modern psychology, including consideration of philosophical foundations and theoretical systems.

title: Hist & Culture of Anc Israel
description: Israelite history and culture in Canaan/Israel from c. 2000 B.C. to A.D. 200.  Methodology for using the Bible in historical research.

title: History&Philosophy of Biology
description: Development of fundamental generalizations of biology; nature of science; applications to major philosophical issues of current science.

title: Hist & Philos Micro & Mol Biol
description: Exploring the historical and philosophical context of great discoveries in microbiology and molecular biology through readings, group discussions, and analytical writing.

title: History&Philosophy of Science
description: Scientific explanation, concepts, and models. Philosophical assumptions and criteria for theory selection, as exemplified by historical development of basic ideas in science.

title: Hist & Phil of Technology Educ
description: Historical and philosophical basis of today's technology programs.

title: Hist & Soc Sci Tchng Methods
description: Developing meaningful and engaging instruction for secondary students; developing critical thinking, problem solving, literacy, and democratic character; assessing learner performance.

title: History & Systems of  Psych
description: Survey of origins and development of modern psychology, including consideration of the schools and theoretical systems.

title: Hist & Theory of Translation
description: History of translation as a discipline, with attention to core methodological and philosophical issues and challenges. Survey of past agents of translation, key translated texts, and translation in the Western world, particularly the Spanish-speaking tradition.

title: History of American Families
description: History of American families from colonial period to the present.

title: History of Ancient Iraq
description: Examining the social and economic aspects of the rise of cities, inter-regional trade, political exchange, and imperialism in ancient Mesopotamia using primary and secondary sources.  Topics include agriculture in Babylon, cities in Mesopotamia, royal courts, Assyrian trade and markets, family and kin.

title: History of Animation
description: Origins and developments of animation internationally to the present, focusing on aesthetic, technical, political, and economic aspects of the medium.

title: History of Anthropology
description: Historical approach to development of anthropological knowledge, including archaeological and sociocultural method and theory.

title: History of Apparel
description: Costume, clothing, and textiles as mediums for understanding the stages and states of individuals, families, and societies; apparel diversity and cultural identity.

title: History of Argentina
description: Rise of modern Argentina from colonial times, focusing on the dynamic political, economic, social, and cultural developments since independence.

title: Asian Religion & Thought
description: Major themes in religion, philosophy, and ideas in Asia.

title: History of Costume
description: History of dress and clothing from the ancient world through the twenty-first century, applied to costume design for theatre and media arts.

title: Hist of Documntry&Nonfic Film
description: Introduction to and contextualization of documentary film from its inception to present.

title: History of Ethics
description: Designed to survey the history of ethics or to examine multiple periods and figures in the history of philosophy.

title: History of French
description: Introduction to the diachronic study of French beginning with its roots in Latin.

title: History of Graphic Desgn
description: Survey of graphic design historical periods from pre-history to present day.

title: Hist Higher Educ
description: Historical review of challenges facing higher educational administration in today's colleges and universities.

title: History of Ideas
description: Interrelationship of influential ideas and historical events from the end of the eighteenth century to the present.

title: Hist of Interior Design&Arch 1
description: History of interior design, architecture, and furnishings from ancient Egypt to beaux arts movement. French, English, and American design.

title: Hist of Interior Design&Arch 2
description: Furniture, interior design, and architecture from Industrial Revolution to present.

title: History of Jazz
description: Survey of jazz history, emphasizing periods, styles, and artists through the analysis of published transcriptions and arrangements.

title: History of Modern Deaf Culture
description: An exploration of the emergence of a Deaf School in the United States and the evolution of Deaf culture from 1817 to the present.

title: History of Philosophy 1
description: The history of philosophy from Greek antiquity to the Renaissance; exploring the nature of reality, knowledge, and human flourishing through the perspective of key figures, movements, and texts.

title: History of Philosophy 1
description: Western civilization from Greek antiquity to Renaissance, primarily from perspective of philosophy; exploring fundamental questions in human experience; examining formative events in history; understanding value of important texts.

title: History of Philosophy 2
description: Western civilization from Renaissance to present, primarily from perspective of philosophy; exploring fundamental questions in human experience; examining formative events in history; understanding value of important texts.

title: History of Philosophy 2
description: The history of philosophy from the early modern period to the present; exploring the nature of reality, knowledge, and human flourishing through the perspective of key figures, movements, and texts.

title: History of Photography
description: Origin and development of photographic aesthetics.

title: History of Photography
description: The general history of the photographic medium from its inception to the present day.  The evolution of the medium, its various uses, primary figures, basic technologies, and artistic trends.

title: History of Products
description: Overview of artifacts and products; how they have influenced society from prehistory to present day.

title: Hist of Rhetoric
description: Major texts, thinkers, and movements of the Western rhetorical tradition from classical antiquity to the present.

title: Hist of Teaching & Teacher Ed
description: History of teaching as a cross-generational social and cultural activity; teacher education as a professional practice with present-day educational implications.

title: Hist of the Book
description: History and development of the book, including modern methods and practices.

title: Hist of the English Language
description: Basic changes from Old English to modern English, including modern American dialects.

title: Hist of the German Language
description: Linguistic survey of the German language from Indo-European to modern times, including phonology, morphology, syntax, and lexicon.

title: The Mediterranean
description: Explores the historiography and political, cultural, economic, and social history of the Mediterranean in the early modern period.

title: Hist Ottoman Empire
description: Examining historiography and key political, cultural, economic, environmental, and social developments in the Ottoman Empire 1300-1923. Emphasizing the impact of identity in a multi-national, multi-ethnic, multi-religious, geographically and linguistically diverse state.

title: Hist of Portuguese Lang
description: Linguistic sources that contributed to formation of Portuguese.

title: History of Spanish Language
description: Linguistic sources that contributed to formation of the Spanish language.

title: History of Travel & Tourism
description: The history of travel and tourism from modern times to the present. Themes include changing technology, consumerism, nationalism, and social identities in constructing the tourist experience.

title: Music History: 20th-21st c
description: Survey of European and American art music of the twentieth and twenty-first centuries.

title: Music History: Baroque
description: Survey of European art music of the Baroque period.

title: Music History: Classic
description: Survey of European art music of the Classic period.

title: Music History: Overview
description: Overview of Western music history from the Middle Ages to the Present, introducing principal composers, styles, genres, and forms.

title: Music History: Romantic
description: Survey of European art music of the Romantic period.

title: Holography
description: Special topics in electromagnetics. Development of visual and mathematical models for understanding diffraction and interference; creation of Gabor, Denisyuk, Leith-Upatnieks, and Benton holograms; and study of the limitations and opportunities in current approaches to advanced 3D displays.

title: Home and Family Living
description: Principles for creating an optimal home environment for individual, marital, and family development; secular and sacred significance of temporal activities in the home; the influence of context and family processes on outcomes.

title: Home-Based Entrepre
description: Exploration of home-based business tools and practical application of entrepreneurs including; writing branded content for social media, search engine optimization, logistic management, wholesaling and manufacturing options, securing funding and accounting applications as well as legal and ethical requirements of owning your own business.\n

title: Homer, the Odyssey
description: In-depth study of Homer's Odyssey.

title: Homiletics Lab
description: Introducing chaplain candidates to the various styles of sermon delivery: thematic, expository, narrative, and exegetical. Practice of sermon delivery as it pertains to funerals, memorial ceremonies, weddings, and small or large group worship.

title: Homological Algebra
description: Chain complexes, derived functors, cohomology of groups, ext and tor, spectral sequences, etc. Application to algebraic geometry and algebraic number theory.

title: Honors Thesis
description: Advanced research and writing on an approved honors thesis topic.

title: Horace
description: In-depth study of the poetry of Horace.

title: Horm Behav
description: Neural and endocrine mechanisms underlying behavior.

title: Horn
description: Private or semiprivate instruction. One to two hours of daily practice

title: Hospitality Management
description: Introducing hospitality management; integrating with venue and experience management; considering foundational principles, best professional practices; exploring professional opportunities.

title: Housing the Family
description: Social-psychological, economic, and political aspects of housing families; making selections that will enhance the quality of housing, increase productivity, and protect the health, safety, and well-being of the family across the life cycle.

title: How to Program
description: Introduction to programming and computer science for those with no prior programming experience. Focuses on the basic aspects of programming, with an emphasis on core principles. Labs provide a supportive environment to learn how to program with peers. Weekly discussions will introduce some of the many ways computer science interacts with society. Programming assignments will demonstrate how to use computing in a variety of disciplines. \n

title: HRM Implementation
description: Integrative course on human resource management strategy formulation and implementation, including a field study. Topics include organizational alignment (HR structure and processes that fit the strategic goals of the organization), change management, and strategic leadership.

title: Human Anatomy (with lab)
description: Rigorous, in-depth coverage of the structure and function of the human body. Gross and microscopic anatomy of all major organ systems with their associated organs and tissues. Fundamental physiology concepts in each system are also introduced. Lab instruction includes prosected human cadavers.

title: Human Anatomy (w/ virtual lab)
description: Structure and function of the human body.  Virtual lab experience included.

title: Human/Resource Mgmt - Learning
description: Introduction to human resource management in educational organizations. Emphasizes issues related to working with people, policies, laws, and procedures for sound personnel administration practices, including job analysis, recruitment, selection, professional development, supervision, performance appraisal, and managing school and district budgets for improved learning.

title: Human Behav Social Environment
description: Draws from ecosystems, lifespan, and other theoretical perspectives to examine persons in their social environment as individuals, members of families, groups, organizations, and communities. Considers cultural, social, psychological, biological, and spiritual forces.

title: Human Biology
description: Body systems and influence of heredity.

title: Human Development
description: Examines the growth and development of human beings from conception until death including the influences of family, peers, schools, and culture

title: Human Dev: Life Span
description: Interaction of psychological, biological, and social influences on behavior and psychological development through the life span.

title: Human Embryology
description: Developmental milestones of prenatal life: etiology of congenital malformations, emphasizing molecular and cellular changes and their functional consequences.

title: Human Grwth & Dvlp
description: Psychoeducational aspects of developmental theory across the life span, including psychosocial, moral, ego, cognitive, faith, and identity. Developmental implications in the counseling process.

title: Neuro/Biol Bases of Behavior
description: Critical study of brain-behavior relationships.

title: Human Obesity
description: Comprehensive examination of the trends, implications, treatment, and prevention of human obesity taught from the scientific, evidence-based literature.

title: Human Osteology
description: Identification and treatment of skeletal material found in archaeological excavations.

title: Human Physiology
description: Function of body organ systems.

title: Human Resource Management
description: Introduction to theoretical principles and best practices for selecting, assessing, motivating and developing an organization's most important asset: its employees.

title: Human Resource Management
description: Current theory and practice of human resource management in the public and not-for-profit sectors.

title: Human Resource Mgt
description: Functions of human resource management: employee selection, wage and salary administration, training and development, employee relations, and human resource planning.

title: HRM Lecture Series
description: Human resource executive guest lecture series. Students will gain exposure to human resource management (HRM) professionals and learn more about the challenges and opportunities that HRM careers provide.

title: Human Resource Mgt Skills
description: Acquiring skills and competencies including selection, compensation, performance evaluation, training evaluation, organizational assessment, and research methodology.

title: Human Rights
description: Causes of human rights violations and societal and state responses; nature, history, and impacts of international human rights norms; ways to define and promote rights.

title: Human Sexuality & Soc W Pract
description: Overview of human sexuality.  Introduction to treatment of sexual problems and disorders.

title: Design Thinking- Social Impact
description: Apply a systematic human-centered approach to social innovation and creative problem solving. Learn tools and techniques focused on empathizing with the beneficiaries of the innovation, defining the beneficiaries' needs, ideating to create ideas for innovative solutions, prototyping creative solutions, and testing those solutions.

title: Humanities & Professional Life
description: This course helps students frame their humanities experience as professional preparation. Students will learn how to translate the unique value of their degree as they pursue a variety of professional paths. In short, this class will explore what a Humanities graduate can do and why humanistic study meets so many needs in the modern workplace. By focusing on core professional competencies, students will find ways to make their major coursework relevant to life after graduation.

title: Humanities Lecture Series
description: Lecture and discussion by scholars in the humanities, with supplementary reading and writing.

title: Humanities of Africa
description: Major arts of African cultures in their historical, religious, and philosophical settings.

title: Humanities of East Asia
description: This course will introduce students to the humanities of Japan, China, and Korea, paying particular attention to the way visual art, architecture, ritual, film, literature, and other forms shed light on the religious traditions shared by these traditions.

title: Humanities of Latin America
description: Achievements of Latin American culture regarding art, philosophy, literature, and music from the pre-Columbian era to the present.

title: On-campus Experiential Project
description: Practical, on-campus (not in the field) projects in which education is directly applied to real-world solutions for companies and other organizations. Students apply and are accepted to work on specific projects based on their skills, interests, and major emphasis.

title: Humanities Research Seminar
description: Research, writing, and discussion exploring enduring questions from perspectives offered by humanities disciplines.

title: Hungarian Dance Tech1
description: Hungarian dance techniques and skills from throughout the Carpathian Basin. \n\n

title: Hungarian Dance Tech 2
description: Advanced Hungarian dance techniques and skills from throughout the Carpathian Basin.

title: HWSG Internship
description: On-the-job experience for Huntsman World Senior Games interns.

title: Hydraulic Design of Channels
description: Design of water conveyance channels and control structures, including siphons, chutes, weirs, flumes, dams, spillways, and outlet works.

title: Hydraulic Engineering
description: Application of fluid mechanics principles to analysis and design of hydraulic structures and systems.

title: Hydrogeochemistry
description: Nature and origin of solutes and isotopes in groundwater systems. Applying geochemistry to evaluation of groundwater recharge conditions and flow patterns.

title: Hydroinformatics
description: Principles of hardware and software systems for water and climate data collection, storage, sharing, interpretation, analysis, and modeling.

title: Hydrology
description: Waters of the earth, their occurrence, circulation, and distribution. Relationships among precipitation, evaporation, infiltration, transpiration, groundwater, and stream runoff.

title: Don Quijote
description: In-depth study of Cervantes's  <i>El ingenioso hidalgo don Quijote de la Mancha.<i/>

title: Don Quijote
description: In-depth study of Cervantes' El ingenioso hidalgo don Quijote de la Mancha.

title: Ice Hockey, Beginning
description: Basic power skates, puck and stick handling, and game strategies.

title: Ice Hockey, Intermediate
description: Developing intermediate ice hockey skills.

title: Ice Skating, Beginning
description: Developing figure skating skills.

title: Ice Skating, Intermediate
description: Developing intermediate ice skating skills.

title: Ichthyology
description: Fish systematics, evolution, morphology, distribution, and natural history.

title: Ideation & Team Formation
description: Learn processes and methodologies to generate innovative business and product ideas across various industries and domains, and then determine the market opportunity and potential for ideas. In collaboration with teams, apply decision making frameworks to determine whether to pursue opportunities.

title: Igneous Petrology
description: Origin and evolution of magmas, emphasizing trace element and isotopic compositions and intensive properties as calculated from mineral compositions.

title: Illustration Fundamentals
description: Illustrative concepts and problem solving with an overview of styles, techniques, methods, and materials.

title: Immigrant Rights
description: This course is devoted to an exploration of the rights and obligations aliens have when they are within U.S. borders.  Students will examine when and how these rights and obligations are complicated for individuals and communities by a lack of U.S. citizenship. For example, are noncitizens eligible for welfare benefits or public employment?  Should lawful permanent residents be allowed t

title: Immigration Law
description: Overview of the powers to regulate immigration law; admission and removal of foreigners; refugee and asylum law; impact of business/employment-based immigration.

title: Immigration Law Practicum
description: Focus on developing an in-depth understanding and practical knowledge of the procedures, substantive requirements, and best practices relating to representing foreign-born citizens or the United States Department of Homeland Security in federal deportation hearings. The most common applications for relief in such proceedings including asylum, cancellation of removal for permanent residents, cancellation of removal for non-lawful permanent residents, and adjustment of status. Deportation custody/detention authority and release, as well as voluntary departure for those who are not eligible to remain in the United States under any of the above-described applications.

title: Immunohematology
description: Theory and practice of blood banking.

title: Immunology
description: Advanced concepts of immunological processes.

title: Immunology Lab
description: Laboratory exercises in advanced concepts of  immunological processes.

title: Impact Investing
description: Impact investing markets, analysis, due diligence, and practice.

title: Inclusion & Disabilities in TR
description: Making recreation / leisure services available to all populations.  Analyzing implications of the Americans with Disabilities Act in recreational settings.  Preparing recreation providers with knowledge and practical experience to enable them to include people from populations that have historically been underserved.

title: Independent Readings
description: Independent readings of Arabic materials.

title: Independent Rdngs
description: Readings in education.

title: Independent Readings
description: Supervised research experiences related to literature review in psychology.

title: Independent Readings
description: Faculty-supervised readings as arranged by student.

title: Indep Readings or Project
description: Students meet with the instructor to assemble an individualized reading program in Early Childhood Education and agree upon the topic and organization of the course.

title: Indepndent Readings or Project
description: Students meet with the instructor to assemble an individualized reading program in Elementary Education and agree upon the topic and organization of the course.

title: Indpndnt Research
description: Student research mentored by faculty member.

title: Independent Research
description: Writing for professional publication.  Faculty-supervised research for organizing, writing, and submitting the master's research project for publication.

title: Independent Research
description: Faculty-supervised research as arranged by student.

title: Indep Research
description: Conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and evaluating a student-initiated project in a school classroom for curriculum improvement.

title: Independent Research
description: Individual research study or project under the direction of a faculty member.

title: Independent Research
description: Supervised research experiences related to data gathering, analysis, and writing in psychology.

title: Independent Research & Dev
description: Individually preparing technical content associated with selected technological emphases.

title: Independent Study
description: Study experience in an area of specialization under direction of a faculty member.

title: Indep Study in Nursing
description: Topics such as NCLEX exam preparation, SNA leadership, personal wellness, etc. that support and/or enhance the nursing program curriculum. Check section headers for specific course content.

title: Indian Dance: prct/thry, tech1
description: Indian dance technique from selected classical, folk, and popular dance styles.

title: Individual Development
description: Applying theories of psychological development (including rational living, positive psychology, and dialectical behavior therapy) in a self-assessment approach to promoting self-awareness and psychological development.

title: Individual French Lang Review
description: Guided individual online language practice.

title: Individual Readings in English
description: Language and/or literature beyond what is offered in the curriculum.

title: Individual Research & Study
description: Individual research mentored by Exercise Sciences faculty. Number of credits is based on hours worked per week under contract.

title: Individual Study
description: In-depth study into any chosen art-historical era.

title: Individual Study in Chinese
description: Assignments to fit individual needs of the advanced student.

title: Individual Study
description: Faculty-supervised instruction/research to fit the individual needs of the advanced student. Terms must be established by contract and approved by chair.

title: Individual Study in Hebrew
description: Focused acquisition of knowledge.  Students will concentrate on a specific topic of study and increase their knowledge of and ability to use Hebrew language appropriate to that field.

title: Individual Study in Italian
description: Assignments to fit individual needs of the advanced student.

title: Individual Study in Japanese
description: Topics vary. Assignments to fit individual needs of the advanced student.

title: Individual Study in Korean
description: Individual assignments appropriate to needs of advanced students.

title: Indoor Cycling
description: Students in the class will be guided through weekly cycling exercise sessions to improve their cardiovascular fitness and aerobic endurance as well as increase their leg muscle strength and power.

title: Indoor Rock Climbing
description: Basic climbing skills; including the figure eight knot, belaying, proper climbing techniques, movement skills, and bouldering.

title: Industrial Automation
description: Application of sensors, actuators, robotics, part feeding and assembly, PLCs, pneumatic and hydraulic control, for justifying industrial automation.

title: Industrial Catalytic Processes
description: Fundamentals of catalytic chemistry and materials; applications to important industrial catalytic processes.  Includes catalyst materials and preparation, catalyst characterization, fixed-bed reactor design, and catalyst deactivation.

title: Industrial Organic Chemistry
description: Fundamentals of organic compound bonding, shape, structure, conformations, acidity, properties, kinetics, thermodynamics, reactions, and reaction mechanisms. Emphasis on organic reactions related to industrial chemistry processes.

title: Industrial Organization
description: Industrial organization focuses on firm behavior in imperfectly competitive markets.  Typical topics include the acquisition and use of market power by firms, strategic interactions among firms, and an introduction to noncooperative game theory.

title: Inequality & Society
description: Distribution of economic and social resources (financial, status, prestige, power, and authority) as they relate to life changes, lifestyle, and social justice.

title: Infant Dev in the Family
description: Conception, prenatal development, pregnancy. Physical, cognitive, and social development of the first twenty-four months. Implications for guidance and care in the family.

title: Infection & Immunity
description: Principles of infectious organisms (principally bacteria and viruses), the diseases they cause, and the role of host immune responses in health and disease.

title: Health Systems and Policy
description: Health policy and systems from a global perspective. Emphasis on policy analysis and the political dimensions of health policymaking.

title: Informatics & Health Care Tech
description: Use of patient care and other technologies to deliver, integrate, coordinate, and improve outcomes of care.

title: Information Privacy Law
description: In-depth analysis of the different types of law (constitutional, tort, contract, property, and statutory) that address threats to privacy in the information society.

title: Information Retrieval
description: IR modeling, IR query languages, text indexing and searching, retrieval evaluation, query and text operations, parallel and distributed IR, Web searching.

title: Information Security Mngmnt
description: How technology, organizations, and people interact to create secure information systems. Topics include data encryption, physical security, information security policies, and security awareness and training.

title: IS Product Management
description: Product management techniques from gathering requirements, choosing a solution, and planning its implementation.

title: IS Project Management
description: Principles and skills of project management in an information systems context, including management of risk, schedule, scope, cost, quality control, communications, human resources, and procurement.

title: IS Security & Controls
description: Concepts and techniques for securing information systems and applying controls to business processes.

title: IT Special Topics
description: Unique topics in information technology for graduate students only.  Independent study with a faculty mentor.

title: Information Theory
description: Mathematical development of information theory applied to data communications and coding. Topics include entropy, mutual information, channel capacity, data compression, rate distortion theory, etc.

title: Infrastructure Asset Mgmt
description: Explore how infrastructure is planned, delivered, operated, and maintained. Analyze challenges associated with infrastructure asset management. Evaluate the infrastructure life cycle, including strategic planning, investment and funding, decision making and prioritization, innovative design and construction processes, and long-term maintenance. Explore principles and practice of infrastructure asset management and resilient design, construction, and operation. The broad themes of sustainability and multi-disciplinary solutions are incorporated throughout the course.

title: Injury & Violence Prevention
description: Concepts and interventions related to both unintentional injuries and violence.

title: Innovation & Entrepreneurship
description: Develop ideas into a business model. Learn product development. Entrepreneurial concepts and practices. Strategic planning and global competitiveness.

title: Innovation & Entrepreneurship
description: Creating and capturing value through individual and organizational innovation; strategies to increase the flow of innovation and the probability of success.

title: Innovation
description: Through a series of hands-on experiences, students explore principles, methods, and tools of innovation and design thinking in technology and engineering.

title: Innovation Practicum
description: Theory and practice of innovation, emphasizing the discovery and development of innovative ideas in interdisciplinary teams.

title: Innovative Team Leadership
description: Creative leadership strategies and styles; team dynamics; leadership theory; the Army leadership framework.  Includes basics of land navigation and squad tactics.  Lab included.

title: Inorganic Chemistry
description: In-depth treatment of theoretical concepts in inorganic chemistry and solid state, organmetallic, and bioinorganic chemistry.

title: Inspiring Leadership
description: Students will engage leadership theories, identify and cultivate their own approach to leadership, and take the first steps in developing a leadership plan relating to organizational or social change. Developing a leadership plan to prepare to use legal education to lead change.

title: Installation
description: Developing an artistic voice while exploring various installation art practices.

title: Instructional Desn
description: Identifying instructional problems; specifying objectives, instructional strategies, and media; analyzing learning outcomes; developing instructional materials and assessment instruments; validating instructional systems.

title: Inst Design & Assess/All Lrnrs
description: Curriculum design and assessment theory, strategies, and tools for the K-6 classroom. Fundamental concepts in using assessments to evaluate and support language and literacy development for English learners. Use of formal and informal assessment practices to support the learning of all students.

title: Instruc. Design for Business
description: Overview to the field of instructional design as a discipline, including what careers are available in the discipline. Also, how instructional design is used to create educational products, especially eLearning.

title: Instructional Leadership 1
description: Examining, understanding, and applying organizational theory, strategy, and strategic thinking to the various roles of school leadership in shaping the structures and cultures supportive of student and educator learning.

title: Instructional Leadership 2
description: Instructional leadership and school improvement processes in creating and sustaining successful learning communities to improve teaching and learning, including formative instructional supervision, professional development, and action research for school improvement.

title: Instruct Ldrshp Learning Comms
description: Leading and improving successful teaching and learning through applying theory and practice of instructional leadership in learning communities.

title: Instructional Product Dev
description: Designing, developing, and troubleshooting instructional products using industry-standard tools.

title: Instructional Tech for EAC
description: Using instructional design, visual design, and differentiated staffing principles, along with multimedia authoring systems, telecommunication, and other computer-based tools in the development of educational applications for early childhood, elementary, and special education settings.

title: Instructional Tech in Teaching
description: Using instructional design, visual design, and differentiated staffing principles along with multimedia authoring systems, telecommunication, and other computer-based tools in the development of educational applications for secondary education settings.

title: Instr Visual/Video
description: Designing, producing, and integrating audio, visual, and video instructional materials. Applying digital and other technologies in audio recording and mixing, and photographic and video production.

title: Instrumental Analysis Lab
description: Continuation of Chem 521. Laboratory experience with modern analytical instrumentation.

title: Instrumental Analysis Lecture
description: Modern instrumental methods and basic principles of instrumentation.

title: Instr Conduct & Error Detect
description: Development of critical rehearsal and conducting skills through score preparation, lesson planning, rehearsal goals and predicting issues, performance accuracy, score transpositions, error detection, conducting gesture analysis, and music-mapping for the development of expressive conducting gesture.

title: Instrumental Conducting Techn
description: Physical techniques and musical understanding required to conduct an instrumental performance ensemble.

title: Instrumental Methods
description: Use of instrumentation for determining mineralogical, chemical, and isotopic composition of geological materials.

title: Insurance Law
description: Insurance law including formation, interpretation, and enforcement of the insurance contract; coverage issues, legal aspects of the regulation of the insurance industry.

title: Integrated Curriculum
description: Implementing integrated learning experiences in dance, music, drama, and visual art for the very young, including importance of home, family, and environments on child's aesthetic growth.

title: Integrated Prodct&Proc Desgn 1
description: Comprehensive two-semester design experience from conception to manufacturing planning and prototype. Product development process. Economic and manufacturing considerations. Intellectual property agreement required.

title: Integrated Quantum Photonics
description: Design, fabrication, and analysis of chip-scale optical circuits. Classical and quantum performance characteristics of several circuit components, as well as applications in computing, sensing, and communications. Students will design a custom integrated photonic circuit, which will be fabricated and tested in a silicon foundry during the semester. Students will analyze their measured devices using the tools learned in the class.

title: Integrated Topics
description: Valuation, forecasting, measurement issues, and quantifying uncertainty. Capstone cases and projects.

title: Integrating K-12 in El. Ed.
description: Students will develop the knowledge, skills, and dispositions to develop and integrate emerging technologies into elementary education.

title: Intgrtng Technology in ECE
description: Integrating instructional technology with early childhood education instructional strategies.

title: Integrating Technlgy in ElEd
description: Integrating instructional technology into K-6 instructional strategies.

title: Intgrtng Technology in SpEd 1
description: Integrating instructional technology with special education instructional strategies.

title: Intgrtng Technology in SpEd 2
description: Integrating instructional technology with special education instructional strategies.

title: Integrative Exercise
description: Integrated applications of case analysis and presentation skills.  Group work to analyze cases and formulate recommendations, followed by professional presentations to groups representing management.

title: Integrative Field Seminar 1
description: Classroom seminar to examine relationship between theory and practice as it relates to the field experience at the foundational level.

title: Integrative Field Seminar 2
description: Classroom seminar to examine relationship between theory and practice as it relates to the field experience at an advanced level.

title: Integrative Persuasive Comms
description: Persuasion theories and links to practice of integrated communications, including promotion, advertising, public relations, direct marketing, and branding.

title: Integrative Practicum
description: Supervised assessment and intervention, integrating psychopathology diagnosis and treatment.

title: Integrity for Life
description: Exploring integrity in depth, developing personal values rooted in integrity, and understanding how to make intentional decisions to become better citizens and disciples of Jesus Christ.

title: IP Litigation
description: Considerations for the filing of a patent, trademark, and/or copyright complaint, preparation of discovery requests in patent cases, preliminary injunction briefing and argument involving patent and/or trademark issues, patent claim construction briefing and argument, depositions of plaintiff's and defendant's experts, and summary judgment briefing and argument involving patent issues.

title: Intelligence Assessment
description: Methods used in assessing intellectual status in children and adults.

title: Intensive Port Skills Develop
description: Intensive development of oral and literacy skills at the ﻿Intermediate High﻿ to ﻿Advanced Low﻿ level, with emphasis on improving grammatical accuracy, fluency, and cultural competence.  Intended to prepare students for Port 321 and subsequent courses.

title: Intensive Span Skills Develop
description: Intensive development of oral and literacy skills at the Intermediate High to Advanced Low level, with emphasis on improving grammatical accuracy, fluency, and cultural competence.  Intended to prepare students for Span 321 and subsequent courses.

title: Leading and Thriving
description: Building on principles and practices around happiness and positive psychology from Part 1, students will explore the implications for thriving personally, in families, and professional around time and energy, essentialism, GRIT, and physical and spiritual well-being. Using content from the entire course and their EMBA experience, students will build a Plan to Thrive (PTT) and in a two day experience, share, revise and present their plans in a culminating experience.

title: Leading and Thriving II
description: Building on principles and practices around happiness and positive psychology from EMBA 595R, continue to study the principles of thriving. Using content from the Epic Learning Adventure,  students will build a Plan to Thrive.

title: Leading/Thriving I
description: Principles and practices for intentionally thriving for self, family, and business leadership, culminating in a three-day learning adventure to experience principles in a real world context.

title: Inter-American Relations
description: Decline of Europe's American empires, legacies bequeathed to the new republics by their European heritage, and how those legacies have affected relations among the various American republics.

title: Inter-Family Dynamics
description: Advanced study in recognizing interpersonal patterns of human behavior; how human interactional patterns affect personal and family relationships.

title: Interaction Design 2
description: Explores how interaction design integrates both client/user needs to prototype holistic and appropriate experiences. Through team-based course work students gain an understanding of user experience design and workflow.

title: Sound Flds & Vibrating Strctrs
description: Sound-structure interactions. Sound transmission through panels and sound-isolation techniques. Advanced passive and active techniques in sound and vibration control. Near-field acoustic holography.

title: Graphics and Image Processing
description: Introduces basic concepts of computer graphics and image processing. Includes characteristics of physical cameras and displays; color models; basic image processing algorithms: 2D and 3D homogeneous coordinate transformations; fundamentals of 3D rendering geometry; lighting and shading: image warping and texture mapping; and frequency-domain processing.

title: Interactive Software Systems
description: Fabrication of interactive experiences in the context of emerging technologies; recent advances in human-computer interaction.

title: Interactive Typographic Sys
description: Introduces foundational interaction design principles and tools to prototype user-centered interfaces. Through team-based course work students gain user interface experience and work-flow best practices.

title: Intercollegiate Athletics
description: Course for university teams only.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Baseball
description: Competence and technique in baseball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athletics Cheer
description: Competence and technique in cheer through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Cosmo Dunk Team
description: Course for university teams only.

title: Intercol Athl Cougarettes
description: Performance with the Cougarettes competitive team.

title: Intercol Athl Diving
description: Competence and technique in diving through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Basketball
description: Competence and technique in basketball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Diving
description: Competence and technique in diving through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Football
description: Competence and technique in football through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Golf
description: Competence and technique in golf through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Swimming
description: Competence and technique in swimming through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Tennis
description: Competence and technique in tennis through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Track&Fld
description: Competence and technique in track and field through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Men's Volleyball
description: Competence and technique in volleyball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Swimming
description: Competence and technique in swimming through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Track and Field
description: Competence and technique in track and field through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Basketball
description: Competence and technique in basketball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Diving
description: Competence and technique in diving through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Golf
description: Competence and technique in golf through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Gymnastics
description: Competence and technique in gymnastics through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Soccer
description: Competence and technique in soccer through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Softball
description: Competence and technique in softball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Swimming
description: Competence and technique in swimming through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Tennis
description: Competence and technique in tennis through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Track&Fld
description: Competence and technique in track and field through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercol Athl Wmn's Volleyball
description: Competence and technique in volleyball through practice and competition for the University Intercollegiate Athletics team.

title: Intercultural Communication
description: Communication processes as affected by proxemic, kinesic, linguistic, social, institutional, worldview, value differences, and other aspects of culture. Seminar/workshop: theory, research methods, applications.

title: Intercultural Outreach Prep
description: Developing abilities to prepare and share international understanding in public and private schools.

title: Interdisciplinary Innovation
description: This course introduces and practices the fundamental concepts of interdisciplinary market-pull innovation and entrepreneurship in a mentored setting. Interdisciplinary student teams conceive of and develop an internet-connected physical product. The doubleÂ­ diamond innovation model is used, with an emphasis on prototyping and testing.

title: Product Design for Education
description: Project-based course in the development of educational products. Students work in teams, using skills from their individual majors, to help design, develop, and deliver a product to a client in the community.

title: Interdisciplinary Projects
description: Research-driven, interdisciplinary art projects covering relational aesthetics, social practice, and spatial thinking. Course designed to encourage innovation, interaction, and collaboration, expanding students' engagement with art and taking it beyond the private studio.

title: Interest Groups
description: Theories on formation and maintenance of interest groups; tactics of groups in legislative, executive, bureaucratic, and court settings; influence of groups on elections and public policy.

title: Int & Ideas, Amer Founding
description: A systematic investigation of the American founding, focusing on key interests and ideas represented at the Federal Convention of 1787 (and in other seminal events) emphasizing historical and empirical literature.

title: Interface & Usability
description: Introduction to the process and methodology of designing across multiple media types. An introduction to designing interactive experiences.

title: Interfaith Lecture Series
description: To develop a deep and abiding appreciation and understanding of religious faiths, doctrines, practices, spiritual sensitivities, rites and rituals, and fundamental belief systems other than those of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Also to foster an understanding and awareness of how other religions and faith-based traditions function in a modern military setting.

title: Intergovernmental Relations
description: Public service employees work in settings of increasing interdependence and complexity. Introduction to the managerial and organizational implications of federalism, networking, coordination, cooperation, and collaboration.

title: Interior Plants & Landscapes
description: Overview of proven health, environmental, psychological, and productivity benefits by the inclusion of plants in the indoors; learn how plants clean the indoor air; identify cultural, artistic, and enriching ways interior plants are used today as in the past; learn the scientific and common names and understand the care, maintenance, and use of the scientifically top-rated plants based on their ecological benefits; plan, install, and maintain attractive and functional interior landscapes.

title: Intermediate Algebra
description: Elementary logic, real number system, equations and inequalities (linear, polynomial, rational, and radical expressions), graphing, function notation, inverse function, exponential functions, systems of equations, variations.

title: Intermediate Arabic
description: Continuation of Arab 201.

title: Interm Charac Anim
description: Intermediate character animation and production.

title: Intermediate Conversation
description: Hebrew 311R builds upon skills acquired in first-year and second-year Modern Hebrew classes and emphasizes vocabulary building and conversational fluency in a variety of authentic cultural and social contexts.

title: Intermediate Conversation
description: Intensive vocabulary building and conversation practice. Can be fulfilled through language residency program.

title: Intermediate Conversation
description: Intermediate conversation skills. Continued development of conversation skills in the target language. Vocabulary building and conversation practice.

title: Intermediate Conversation
description: Emphasis on fluency and vocabulary building.

title: Intermed Conversation & Media
description: Capitalizing on daily life in Jerusalem to increase speaking, reading, writing, and listening comprehension in modern Hebrew.

title: Intermed. Digital Illustration
description: Intermediate problems in digital media.

title: Intermediate eLearning Dev.
description: Intermediate level designing, developing, and implementing a learning product.

title: Interm Financial Accounting 1
description: Advanced financial statement development and evaluation. Ethical reasoning applied to critical business decisions.\n

title: Intrmd Fluid Dyn
description: Fluid transport properties, review of integral analysis, Navier-Stokes equations, exact and similarity solutions, boundary layers, vorticity, jets and wakes.

title: Intermediate Formal Logic
description: History and use of first-order logic and second-order logic; natural-deduction and axiomatic proofs; modal logic; set theory and foundations of mathematics.

title: Intermediate French, Part 1
description: Reading, writing, conversation, vocabulary building, and review of grammar.

title: Intermediate French, Part 2
description: Final course for GE Languages of Learning requirement (except for full-time French speaking returned missionaries); extensive reading in French literature and culture.

title: Intermediate GIS
description: Collecting, managing, and analyzing spatial data to solve common geographic tasks.

title: Intermediate Greek
description: Readings from Xenophon with review and continuation of grammar.

title: Intrmd Heat & Mass Transfer
description: Analytical approaches to conduction, convection, and radiation heat transfer. Introduction to mass transfer.

title: Int. Hebrew Lang. Jerusalem
description: Emphasizes intermediate conversation in everyday situations. Students role play various situations in class and then apply learning in Jerusalem.

title: Intermediate Italian 1
description: Reading, writing, conversation, vocabulary building, and review of grammar.

title: Intermediate Italian 2
description: Final course for GE Foreign Language requirement (except for returned missionaries); extensive reading in Italian literature and culture.

title: Intermediate Latin
description: Readings from Caesar, with a review and continuation of grammar.

title: Intermediate Life Drawing
description: Drawing the classic figure from gesture to finished rendering, emphasizing structure, anatomy, form, and medium.

title: Intermed Macroeconomics
description: Intermediate macroeconomic theory, emphasizing income, unemployment, and price-level analysis.

title: Intermediate Mandarin
description: Advanced grammar, the writing system, reading and writing, speaking, and listening.

title: Intermediate Mandarin
description: Advanced grammar, the writing system, reading and writing, speaking.

title: Intermediate Micro Theory 1
description: Producer, consumer, and equilibrium theories; mathematical techniques of unconstrained and constrained optimization introduced and applied extensively.

title: Intermediate Micro Theory 2
description: Welfare theory, imperfect information, imperfect competition, uncertainty, externalities, and public goods.

title: Interm. Nonfiction Production
description: Advanced readings, conceptualization, and practical applications of various nonfiction forms.

title: Inter Practicum in Mar&F Ther
description: Experience in counseling individuals, premarital and marital dyads, families, groups of dyads, and multiple families.

title: Intrmed Russian Study Abroad
description: Grammar and composition, case government, listening and speaking skills.

title: Intermediate Russian Part 1
description: Integration of different aspects of language learning including speaking, listening, reading, writing, and culture.  Geared toward "high-intermediate" language learner without extensive experience abroad.

title: Intermediate Russian Part 2
description: Integration of different aspects of language learning including speaking, listening, reading, writing, and culture.  Geared toward "high-intermediate" language learner without extensive experience abroad.

title: Intermed Sewing Techniques
description: Assessing and executing various sewing techniques, including construction of several full-scale garments.

title: Intermediate Statistics
description: Path analysis, factor analysis, and event history techniques.

title: Intermediate Thermodynamics
description: Review of first and second law analysis; exergy; equations of state and other thermodynamic relations; properties of mixtures and multiphase systems; chemical reactions and equilibrium.

title: Interm 3D Computer Graphics
description: Fundaments of building three-dimensional computer models and setting up model rigs for mobility.

title: Internal Combustion Engines
description: Fundamental operating characteristics of internal combustion engines, spark and compression ignition. Thermodynamic cycle analysis, performance and emissions characterization, and dynamometer testing on CFR and production engines.

title: International Accounting
description: Accounting from an international perspective:  flow of information in multiple currencies, complying with reporting requirements, setting budgets and monitoring performance, and controlling corporate assets through reports and audits.

title: Intl Agricultural Development
description: Problems and emerging solutions in international agricultural development, with emphases on human health and nutrition, sustainable natural resource use in agricultural production, the roles of education and extension, and emerging technologies. Readings, class discussions, and application of principles to a case study project.

title: Academic Internship
description: Individualized work or volunteer experience in an international setting or with an international focus.

title: Business and Culture
description: Understand how national culture influences make international business interactions successful and how decision making is impacted based upon global cultural differences.

title: Intl Business Tours
description: International experience focusing on in-depth tours of global firms in selected countries, including instruction by global business executives. Exposure to global business practices in management, finance, operations, marketing, and strategy.

title: Inter Bus Trans
description: Making, regulating, and breaking international business transactions.  (1) Formation of international business transactions, focusing on contracting for and financing the international sale of goods, licensing and distributorship agreements, and foreign direct investment. (2) Regulation stage of international business transactions, including the transactional reach of U.S. government regulation, regulation of corrupt payments to foreign officials, international protection of intellectual property, and securities and antitrust aspects of international transactions.  (3) Breaking international business transactions; transnational dispute resolution through arbitration and through transnational litigation in U.S. courts.

title: International Cinema
description: Students will view significant films and discuss them in a seminar setting in order to increase cultural awareness, enrich language acquisition, enhance critical analysis abilities, and develop understanding of cinematic art.

title: Int Cinema Studies Capstone
description: Producing a final portfolio and project by International Cinema Studies minors.

title: International Conflict
description: Analysis of theories about the causes of war and peace between states, including factors such as domestic instability, nuclear weapons, and war as a result of a bargaining failure.

title: Intl Construction Practices
description: Interacting with international construction professional, including construction terminology, plan reading, metric measurements, estimating, scheduling, and project management practices.

title: Intl Envrnmntl Law
description: Developing international regimes and norms relating to protection of global environment, including climate change, preservation of wildlife, and biodiversity; freshwater resources and Law of the Sea.

title: International Experience
description: Study abroad to examine International Business techniques and how technology is used to solve a variety of problems. Each country visited is experiencing the technology-based Fourth Industrial Revolution and is trying to establish itself as the leader. Investigate and compare how each country is striving to become the center for the Fourth Industrial Revolution and determine what factors are driving this change.
