description: Topics from semantics to dialectology to sociolinguistics.

title: Special Topics in Port Lit
description: Specific topics in Portuguese (Peninsular) literature. Course content will vary each semester to offer optimum exposure to all areas of Portuguese literature.

title: Special Topics in Psychology
description: Exploration of specific topics that are not currently among the main thematic fields of psychology.

title: Special Topics in Psychology
description: Small-group seminar focusing on a classical text or on readings related to a contemporary issue in theory and research.

title: Spec Topics in Public Health
description: Seminar exploring current global health issues.

title: Spec Topics in Regional Anthro
description: Subjects related to a particular area or people.

title: Spec Tpcs in Rhetoric & Comp
description: Various approaches to rhetoric and composition.

title: Special Topics Sociocltrl Anth
description: Various subjects related to method and theory in sociocultural anthropology.

title: Special Topics in Sociology
description: Course content varies from year to year.

title: Special Topics
description: Course content varies from year to year.

title: Spec Topics in Span-Am Lit
description: Specific topics in Latin American literature. Course content will vary each semester to offer optimum exposure to all areas of Latin American literature.

title: Spec Topics Span Linguistics
description: Topics include semantics, dialectology, and sociolinguistics.

title: Spec Top Span Ling
description: Course content varies yearly; focuses on specific area of linguistics such as dialectology or sociolinguistics.

title: Special Topics in Span Lit
description: Specific topics in Spanish (peninsular) literature. Course content will vary each semester to offer optimum exposure to all areas of Spanish literature.

title: Special Topics in Statistics
description: Offerings available from individual faculty on current topics of interest in statistics.

title: Special Topics
description: Survey or introductory courses on various student development topics related to academic skills, career exploration and development, or mental health.

title: Tpcs Technical & Prof Comm
description: Various approaches to technical and professional communication.

title: Spcl Tpcs in Book of Mormon
description: In-depth study of the Book of Mormon's origins and major teachings.

title: Sp Tpcs in New Testament
description: An in-depth study of an aspect of the New Testament's origins and major teachings.

title: Spcl Tpcs in Old Testament
description: An in-depth study of the Old Testament's origins and major teachings.

title: Spec Topics Theatre Research
description: Special topics in focused historical, theoretical, or critical areas of performance research.

title: Special Topics in Theory & Sys
description: Specialized topics in anthropological theory or the operation of social systems.

title: Special Topics - Ungraduate
description: Classroom study based on student and faculty interest.

title: Specialized Clinical Practice
description: Polish direct practice skills for a seamless transition into community clinical practice agency settings. Focus on additional theories, models, and specialized populations, as well as on developing a professional identity as a clinical social worker.

title: Specialized Direct SWPractice
description: Knowledge and skills necessary to apply appropriate strategies for treating disorders, including depression, anxiety, substance use, and trauma.  Exploration of the relationship between assessment and treatment, and the need for accountability in direct social work practice.

title: Specialty Costumes
description: Advanced skills in millinery, dyes, footwear, and allied project areas.

title: Speciation and Phylogeography
description: Students will understand theoretical foundations of speciation and phylogeography including key theories and research practices; implement empirical approaches to analyze, interpret, and communicate relevant biological issues; and conceive, execute, and present a related independent research study.

title: Speech Anatomy & Physiology
description: Basic anatomy and physiology of speech mechanisms.

title: Speech Processing
description: Analyzing and manipulating speech data.  Developing software applications that include speech recognition and/or speech generation.

title: Speech Science
description: Laboratory investigation of scientific bases of normal and disordered speech perception and production; for audiologists and speech language pathologists.

title: Spir Valu Psychoth
description: Spiritual values and perspectives, issues, and approaches in counseling and psychotherapy.

title: Spirituality in Social Work
description: Interface of religious and social work values, attitudes, and principles.

title: Spoken Arabic - Egyptian
description: Intensive study of the spoken language.

title: Spoken Arabic Tutorial
description: Conversation with a native speaker; movies, plays, and other written sources of colloquial Arabic.

title: Sport & Entrtnmnt Venue Mngmnt
description: Understanding and application of experience management principles including opportunities to deliver community based events.

title: Sport Psychology
description: Application of psychological principles to sporting activities.

title: Sport, Society, & Am Culture
description: Development of sports in American society, emphasizing ethnic and racial groups, social classes, gender, gambling, politics, and social mobility.

title: Sports Communication
description: A comprehensive examination of the current practices, techniques, and professional theories associated with sports communications. Specific attention and instruction will be given to two general areas of expertise and potential career development: 1) Creating communication assets including video, visual, written, and social media production and analytics, and 2) Establishing and maintaining working relationships with a variety of sports entities, including teams, leagues, and other related organizations.

title: Sports Law
description: Examining the different duties of an attorney in the role of "sports agent," including: player/agent recruiting and representation, player/club contract negotiation, marketing and licensing contracts, and career and injury management, supplemented by a review of current topics relevant to attorneys representing professional athletes, university athletic departments, professional teams and leagues, and sports-related industries.

title: Sports Media Research
description: Introduces a variety of information-gathering research strategies and techniques, including digital and social media analytics, used to help students to identify and target audiences with sports-related content.

title: Spreadsheet Programming
description: Automating spreadsheets in Excel, interacting with password-protected web sites, writing code to conduct simulations, solving common database interface problems in Access, etc.

title: Spreadsheet Automation/Modelng
description: Programming in Excel VBA; automating common tasks; retrieving data from web servers; building optimization models and user forms.

title: Spreadsheets & Bus Analysis
description: Basic spreadsheet skills focusing on features in MS Excel such as basic functions, logic and reference functions, statistical functions, what-if analysis, and charting to solve complex business problems. No technical background is necessary.

title: Spreadsheets for Bus Analysis
description: Use of spreadsheets to support business analysis and decision making. Includes sensitivity analysis, pivot tables, introductions to databases and macros, charting, and similar topics.

title: Staff Organization & Operatns
description: Seminar in Army Staff Operations. Various opportunities for leadership and organiztional experience. Lab included.

title: Stage Combat
description: Skills of safe hand-to-hand combat, including use of rapier, dagger, and broadsword, for stage and screen.

title: Stage Directing 1: Princ&Prac
description: Theories and processes of taking a scene from script to production.  Lab required.

title: Stage Directing 2: AdvDirect
description: Directing projects for class critique and public presentation.

title: Stage Management 1
description: Principles and objectives of stage management. Prepares students for work as assistant and production stage managers.

title: Stage Management 2.
description: Students will learn skills of stage management in pre-production, rehearsals, tech rehearsals, performance/calling a show, and post-production responsibilities within educational, community, and professional settings.

title: Stained Glass
description: Methods and processes using leaded glass, copper, foil, and faceted glass.

title: Standard Arabic Tutorial
description: Readings, listening and writing activities, and discussion in Arabic designed to maintain vocabulary and fluency while waiting for study abroad.

title: Standards for Tech Literacy
description: The teaching of technological literacy and engineering problem solving in education specifically focusing on the fields of medical, agricultural, and energy and power technologies.

title: Startup Bootcamp
description: Learn and apply the basic skills to create a startup company. Work in teams to identify entrepreneurial opportunities and develop innovative solutions. Interact with real customers to validate business assumptions. Prepare a financial plan and analyze the viability of the business.

title: Business Career Essentials
description: Introduction for science, math, and statistics majors to careers in industry. Project planning, oral and written business presentations, business accounting, and technology readiness.

title: State&Local Govt 1
description: Interrelationship among national, state, and local governments and the powers of each, as well as examination of separation-of-powers principles and impact of political process at state and local level.

title: State & Local Tax
description: Introduction to principles of multi-state taxation.

title: State Government and Politics
description: Forms of state governments and politics, and relations between state and national governments.

title: Static Systems in Me En
description: Analysis and design of static systems; real world problem solving; forces, moments, and vectors, equilibrium; external and internal forces; centroids and inertia; mechanical engineering fundamentals.

title: Statistical Analysis
description: Introduction to research methods and applied basic statistical procedures including sampling, descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, and linear and multiple regression.

title: Statistical Analysis
description: Calculating inferential statistics commonly used in applied settings; making decisions regarding hypotheses; employing advanced statistical methodologies including multivariate techniques, path analysis, factor analysis, structural equations and hierarchical linear models, when appropriate. Writing and interpreting research findings.

title: Statistical Analysis
description: Quantitative techniques in political research, including probability theory, descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, regression analysis, causal inference, maximum likelihood, and panel data; presenting and summarizing quantitative research to a non-technical audience.

title: Stat Analysis for Biologists
description: Students will learn concepts and applications of statistics and their specific application to research questions spanning diverse subfields of biology. Students will perform these analyses using the R statistical software.

title: Stat & Data Anlys in SocW Res
description: Analyzing data using evidence-based approaches and interpreting major quantitative and qualitative and qualitative methods in social work.

title: Statistical & Thermal Physics
description: Principles of statistical mechanics and thermodynamics, with applications.

title: Statistical Computation
description: Fundamental numerical methods used by statisticians; programming concepts; efficient use of software available for statisticians; simulation studies.

title: Statistical Computing
description: Create and interact with relational databases comprised of large real world data; integrate previous course work into a single research project from formulation to final report; solve statistical problems using a combination of SAS, R, and SQL skills.

title: Statistical Consulting
description: Introduction to statistical consulting, oral presentations, presentation packages, written reports. Extensive applied experience in the Center for Collaborative Research and Statistical Consulting.

title: Stat Learning & Data Mining
description: Multiple linear regression, nonlinear regression, local regression, penalized regression, generalized additive models, logistic regression, discriminant analysis, tree-structured regression, support vector machines, neural networks.

title: Statistical Mechanics
description: Advanced thermodynamics, classical statistical mechanics, quantum statistics, and transport theory.

title: Statistical Mechanics
description: Introduction to classical and quantum statistical mechanics, including Boltzmann, Fermi-Dirac, and Bose-Einstein statistics. Applications of statistical thermodynamics to gases, liquids, and solids.

title: Stat Methods for Research 1
description: Basic statistical methodologies and experimental design. Topics include simple analysis of variance, multiple regression, analysis of covariance, model selection.

title: Stat Methods for Research 2
description: Advanced statistical methodologies and experimental design. Topics include multi-way analysis of variance, mixed models analysis of variance, logistic regression, log-linear models, time series models, principal components, canonical correlation, common experimental designs.

title: Statistical Modeling 1
description: Scientific method, statistical thinking, sources of variation, completely randomized design, ANOVA, power and sample size considerations, multiple testing, randomized complete blocks, factorial designs, interactions. Introduction to statistical software.

title: Statistical Modeling 2
description: Regression, transformations, residuals, indicator variables, variable selection, logistic regression, time series, observational studies, statistical software.

title: Stat Modeling for Data Science
description: Statistical thinking, basic probability and random variables, estimation, uncertainty in estimation, inference and interpretation for the linear model, prediction, model comparison, introduction to Bayesian statistics, binary data, evaluating classification models, data ethics and privacy

title: Statistics for Economists
description: Introduction to data description, visualization, and analysis, including underlying mathematics of probability theory and statistics.  Topics include: probability, random variables, density and distribution functions, estimation, and hypothesis testing.

title: Stat for Engineers & Scientist
description: The scientific method; probability, random variables, common discrete and continuous random variables, central limit theorem; confidence intervals and hypothesis testing; completely randomized experiments; factorial experiments.

title: Statistics for Geographers 1
description: Methodology of spatial analysis.  Theory and techniques in geographic data description and population inference.

title: Statistics for Geographers 2
description: Advanced techniques in geospatial analysis.

title: Stats for Physics-Based Systms
description: Using linear and nonlinear models to design experiments, regress coefficients, and infer confidence intervals for both the regressed coefficients and the predictions for systems with errors in one or several variables.

title: Steel Band
description: Performing Pan music in the Calypso and Soco styles from Trinidad.

title: Stars & Galaxies
description: Stellar atmospheres, stellar interiors, stellar evolution, interstellar matter, galactic structure, external galaxies, and cosmology.

title: Stellar Astrophysics
description: The study of the structure, evolution, and light output of stars and how they fit within the galactic structure.

title: Stellar Astrophysics 1
description: Theory of stellar atmospheres and the internal structure of stars.

title: Stellar Astrophysics 2
description: Theory of stellar atmospheres and the internal structure of stars.

title: Stochastic Processes
description: Review of elementary probability, introduction to random processes: definitions, properties, covariance, spectral density, time average, stationarity, ergodicity, linear system relations, mean square estimation, Markov processes.

title: Storytelling
description: Theories, techniques, and practice in the art of constructing and telling stories for use in performance, recreational, and educational settings.

title: Strategic Ad Campaigns
description: Researching, planning, budgeting, creating, and writing national advertising campaigns; writing and producing a complete advertising plan, accompanied by a formal client presentation.

title: Strategic & Org Leadership
description: Theory and practice of leadership, organizational behavior, organization theory and strategy in education contexts, emphasizing theory application.

title: Strategic Client Acq/Retention
description: Strengthening the art and science of persuasion and influencing in selling and interpersonal leadership skills to drive prospect decision-making towards mutually beneficial outcomes. Leading salespeople and buyers to build a long-term portfolio of loyal, strategic partners.

title: Strategic Communications
description: Students in this class will identify a real organization that requires a strategic communication project to solve an important problem for the organization. Throughout the semester students will then create a strategic plan for the organization. They will then execute a project that helps the organization achieve its strategic communications objectives and evaluate its success. Throughout this process, communication theory, practices, and research will be applied to analyzing and solving public relations, advertising, and other strategic communication problems. Students will create a strategic plan using elements from their previous courses, including the advertising and public relations graduate courses.

title: Strategic Decision Making
description: Economic, philosophic (logical), psychological, political, and history-based models of decision making and judgment; improving students' decision making processes.

title: Strategic Human Resource Mgt
description: HRM from manager's perspective. Employment relationship, recruiting/selection, employment law, performance management, and HRM in emerging companies. Managing human assets within firm's strategy, industry, and stakeholder environment.

title: Strategic Issues in Operations
description: Interface of strategy and manufacturing.  Topics include:  capacity and facilities management, work force management, quality management, technology management, vertical integration, manufacturing infrastructure, manufacturing interface with other functions, and incorporating manufacturing in corporate strategy.

title: Strat Ldrshp for Sch Improvmnt
description: Theoretical foundations of leadership, organizational theory, strategy, and change. Applying strategic leadership and decision making to effectively align school organizational systems of vision/mission, internal organization, and external environment to facilitate school improvement.

title: Strategic Leadership
description: Provides future leaders with a rigorous set of tools and frameworks to successfully lead organizations in a future that is increasingly turbulent and often hostile.

title: Strategic Logistics Management
description: Applying and integrating logistics-related topics, including materials management, physical distribution, inventory management, warehousing, logistics network design, customer service, packaging, and materials handling.

title: Strategic Simulation
description: Participating as teams in an on-line strategy experience and practicing skills in strategy formulation, group decision making, and strategy execution

title: Strategic Sourcing
description: Upstream supply chain activities of supplier selection, management, and development. Topics will include negotiations, costing, product development, and commodity analysis.

title: Sourcing and Logistics
description: Applying and integrating sourcing and logistics-related topics, including: supplier selection, management, and development; cost analysis; total cost of ownership; contract management; category analysis; materials management; physical distribution; inventory management; warehousing; logistics network design; customer service; packaging; and materials handling.

title: Strategic Thinking 1
description: An in-depth exploration of the nature of questions with a focus on developing critical thought and theoretical understanding.

title: Strategic Thinking 2
description: An in-depth exploration of relationships in both personal and professional settings with a focus on developing the soft skills relevant to business managers.

title: Strategic Thinking 3
description: An in-depth exploration of world issues relevant to business managers with a focus on developing a broader horizon for effective leadership.

title: Strategies in Legal Analysis
description: Strategies in Legal Analysis is an Extended Bar Review Course that begins to prepare students to study for and ultimately pass state bar exams.  Specifically, students will receive in-depth skill instruction on reading comprehension, issue identification, rule mastery, legal analysis, multiple-choice question skills, essay writing skills, and critical thinking.  The focus of the class will be on skills, not content; however, content will be used to help students learn the applicable skills.

title: Strategy
description: Application of strategic tools, insights, and frameworks designed to help organizations achieve optimal performance in competitive industries. The course uses business cases to analyze how and why specific strategies succeed or fail.

title: Strategy 1
description: Structured problem solving, strategic thinking, and basic strategy concepts to prepare students to analyze and understand the sources of competitive advantage and superior firm performance.

title: Strategy 2
description: Advanced strategy topics such as growth and diversification strategy, pricing strategy, game theory and competitor analysis, strategy as real options, and strategic flexibility and commitment.

title: Strategy Analytics 1
description: Concepts and tools of economic and quantitative analysis as they relate to the development and success of strategy.

title: Strategy Analytics 2
description: Advanced concepts and tools of economic and quantitative analysis as they relate to the development and success of strategy. Including data gathering, data visualization, and data analysis.

title: Strategy and Economics
description: Concepts and tools of strategic management, with an emphasis on the economic tools influencing the success of strategy in the development of sustainable competitive advantage.

title: Strategy and Economics
description: Concepts and tools of strategic management, with an emphasis on the economic tools influencing the success of strategy in the development of sustainable competitive advantage.

title: Strategy Implementation
description: Integrative course on strategy formulation and implementation, including a field study. Topics include organizational alignment (structure and processes that fit the stragety), change management, and strategic leadership.

title: Strategy Implementation
description: Creating alignment among organizational elements of the firm; managing strategic change; and the role of personal and business values in strategy.

title: Strategy in Peace and War
description: The modern evolution and contemporary development of grand strategies in peace and war, connecting success or failure with unintended consequences. Historical case studies extend from the Thirty Years' War to the Global War on Terrorism.

title: Strategy Lessons from History
description: Historical figures (such as Queen Elizabeth I, Winston Churchill, Brigham Young, and Ernest Shackleton) and their strategic leadership decisions in significant situations, highlighting key management concepts previously studied.

title: Stream & Wetland Ecology
description: Stream and wetland ecology; their biota and their physical/chemical properties.

title: Strength Rehabilitation
description: Overview of different strength rehabilitation methods (and their history); examining their theoretical background and actual practice. Enhancing skills of critically reviewing literature.

title: Strengthening Marriage/Family
description: This course will provide a scholarly study of family-related issues from which evidence-based applications embedded within gospel and family proclamation principles will be provided that equip students with knowledge to engage in successful practices related to dating, marriage, parenting, and running a home.

title: Strengthening Marr & Family
description: Understanding, applying, and sharing principles of successful marriage and family life from the LDS proclamation on the family, using sacred and scholarly perspectives.

title: Stress Management
description: Teaches students the basic principles, theories, and relaxation techniques to effectively manage personal stress. Students gain a greater understanding of the mind-body relationship, learn to employ a holistic approach to stress, and adopt effective cognitive, coping, and relaxation techniques. Ultimately, students experience a more effective approach to optimal lifelong health.

title: Stress Psychobiology
description: Behavioral neurobiology of stress.

title: String Bass
description: Private or semiprivate instruction. One to two hours of daily practice

title: String Literature
description: Survey of literature, including research in field of concentration.

title: String Pedagogy: Bass
description: String pedagogy techniques for bass, with a focus on teaching students of varying levels and organizing a private studio.

title: String Pedagogy: Cello
description: String pedagogy techniques for cello, with a focus on teaching students of varying levels and organizing a private studio.

title: String Pedagogy: Guitar
description: String pedagogy techniques for guitar, with a focus on teaching students of varying levels and organizing a private studio.

title: String Pedagogy: Harp
description: String pedagogy techniques for harp, with a focus on teaching students of varying levels and organizing a private studio.

title: String Pedagogy: Violin/Viola
description: String pedagogy techniques for violin and viola, with a focus on teaching students of varying levels and organizing a private studio.

title: String Teaching Practicum
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Violin
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Bass
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Cello
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Guitar
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Harp
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: Teaching Practicum: Viola
description: Applying pedagogical principles to teaching.

title: String Workshop
description: Continuation of Music 375A. Emphasis on cello and bass.

title: Strings
description: Private or semiprivate instruction. One to two hours of daily practice.

title: STRONG Nation
description: STRONG Nation is a High Intensity Interval (HIIT) exercise program designed to bring about an increase in total body fitness for participants of all levels of condition, ability, and needs.

title: Structural Analysis
description: Methods of statics. Influence line diagrams. Method of virtual work. Plastic hinge analysis. Flexibility (force) method, stiffness (displacement) method, and moment distribution method for analysis of indeterminate beams, trusses, and frames. Introduction to computer structural analysis.

title: Structural Biochemistry
description: Molecular structures of proteins, RNA and DNA as determinants of biological function. Topics include thermodynamics of folding and binding, structural determination, spectroscopy, modeling, protein recognition.

title: Structural Equation Modeling
description: Science and theory; constructs and measurement; surveys and experiments; data screening; human subjects protocols (IRB); factor analysis; model fit; academic writing.

title: Structural Equation Modeling
description: Basic tools in structural equation modeling (SEM), including confirmatory factor analysis (CFA), latent variables, and combining CFA with regression. Applications of SEM to (a) multiple groups, (b) dichotomous and count outcomes, and (c) longitudinal or repeated measures.

title: Structural Geology
description: Geometric, kinematics, and dynamic analysis of tectonic structures.  Several studies will be conducted in the field.

title: Structural Steel Design
description: Design of steel tension members, compression members, beams, beam-columns; elastic and inelastic lateral-torsional buckling; welds and structural fasteners.

title: Structural Wood Design
description: Wood species, composition, and grades; design of beams, columns, shear walls, diphragms, connections, and structural systems.

title: Structure in Language
description: Introduction to the analysis of word and sentence structure.

title: Structure of Chinese
description: Sound, syntax, meaning, and word structure of Mandarin Chinese and its implications to problems of learning Chinese.

title: Structure of Japanese
description: Introduction to grammatical foundations of Japanese sound, word, phrase, and meaning structures, and their practical application to common problems with learning Japanese.

title: Structure of Korean
description: Study morphology, phonetics, phonology, syntax, and semantics in relation to Korean and other languages. Increase awareness of social significance, universality, diversity, complexity of linguistics with the goal of participating more ethically in linguistically diverse communities.

title: Structure of Modern English
description: A thorough consideration of the syntactic structures and patterns of Modern English, with some attention given to possible applications.

title: Structure of Modern German
description: Structural and socio-linguistic study of contemporary German.

title: Structures of the Constitution
description: The Constitution`s distribution of sovereign power between the federal government and the states; its allocation of federal sovereign power among Congress, the president, and the judiciary.

title: Student Journal Production
description: Production of the online student journal Entremundos of the Department of Spanish and Portuguese.

title: Student Leadership Council
description: Course for students selected to the Honors Student Leadership Council.  Members of HSLC advance the Honors Program's Mission through activities, events, marketing, and other program initiatives to cultivate an Honors community of scholars. The council works closely with Honors Program administration and an advisor to provide student input to the program, facilitate outreach, and engage peers in both academic and social pursuits.  Members of HSLC obtain hands-on leadership experience as representatives of the Honors student community.

title: Student Leadership Dev
description: Analysis, synthesis, and integration of personal leadership experienced in an academic context. Successful leadership: decision making, communications, planning, team building, motivation, and interpersonal skills.

title: Student Leadership Internship
description: Coaching and training, both experiential and formal, in the following: volunteer recruitment, mentorship, motivation, and rentention; budget and project management; navigation of administrative environment; public relations and advertising, other aspects of non-profit, volunteer leadership.

title: Student Media Labs
description: Student-run media labs such as the Ad Lab, BioComms Lab, Daily Universe, Newsline, and, PR Intelligence Lab.

title: Seminar in Analytical Chem
description: Exposure to and experience in presenting current research and literature reviews in analytical chemistry to peers and faculty.

title: Student Teaching - HT and SST
description: Capstone, field-based, semester-long experience in teaching secondary students; demonstrating proficiency in all program standards.  Seminar required.

title: Student Teaching - Physical Ed
description: Capstone, field-based, semester-long experience in teaching secondary students; demonstrating proficiency in all program standards. Seminar required.

title: Student Tchg: M/M Disabilities
description: Culminating experience teaching students with mild/moderate disabilities in school settings.

title: Student Tchg: Severe Disabilit
description: Culminating experience teaching students with severe disabilities in school settings.

title: Student Wellness Activities
description: Student Wellness Activities is a variable section of SWELL classes that will be taught on an as-needed basis to include activities not usually taught by Student Wellness. Specific information on the course taught in any given semester or term will be found in course header.

title: Studies in American Literature
description: Selected readings in American literature.

title: Studies in Ancient Art
description: Selected topics in Egyptian, Greek, and Roman art.

title: Studies in Anc Near East Lang
description: Grammar and reading skills.

title: Studies in Ancient Philosophy
description: Selected figures or topics.

title: Studies in Architecture
description: Selected topics in architecture of Europe and America.

title: Studies in Author
description: In-depth study of major French or Francophone authors (e.g., Rabelais, Moliere, Diderot, Balzac).

title: Studies in Baroque Art
description: Selected topics in northern and southern baroque art.

title: Studies in Biological Sciences
description: Intermediate level study of principles of biological sciences requiring some foundational content knowledge; topics may include but are not limited to human, environmental, micro or molecular biology, health and disease, nutrition, genetics, etc.

title: Studies in British Literature
description: Selected readings in British literature.

title: British Theatre Performance
description: Analytical and theoretical study of theatre history, dramatic literature, and performance from the Renaissance to the present through pre- and post-performance study and discussion of a play presented in London by some of the world's most notable theatre companies.

title: Comms Theory
description: Nature and content of contemporary mass communication theory.

title: Studies in Composing
description: Special topics in composing in different media (visual, digital, aural) and genres for a range of purposes and audiences.

title: Studies in Contemporary Phil
description: Selected figures or topics.

title: Studies in Cultural History
description: This course will examine major transformations in the history of Italian society and their cultural impact.

title: Studies in Curatorship
description: Selected topics in curation and the museum.

title: Studies in Dance
description: Experience in dance. Possibilities include but are not limited to study abroad, workshops, or pilot dance courses.

title: Sts 18/19 Cent Art
description: Selected topics in eighteenth- and nineteenth-century art of Europe and America.

title: Studies in Folklore
description: Directed study of folklore and folkways.

title: Studies in French Culture
description: In-depth study of French historical, political, and social issues or artistic trends.

title: Studies in French Linguistics
description: Advanced study of linguistic fields such as phonetics, phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics.

title: Studies in Genre
description: In-depth study of various genres (e.g., epic, novel, lyric, film) and problems of genre in French.

title: Studies in Genre
description: Major genres (epic, tragedy, comedy, historiography, etc.). Topics vary.

title: Studies in Genre
description: Major genres (epic, tragedy, comedy, historiography, etc.). Topics vary.

title: Studies in Genre
description: Literary genres.

title: Studies in Genres & Forms
description: Topics vary and include epic, tragedy, comedy, narrative, historiography, film.

title: Globl & Cltrl Awarenss Studies
description: Intensive examination of issues from a global or cultural perspective.  Presumes some level of foundational content knowledge of familiarity with this approach.

title: Studies in Hebrew Culture
description: Examining and focusing on various topics in Israeli and Hebrew culture, such as history geography, film, literature, language, linguistics, political issues, social structure, philosophy, religion, aesthetics, art, and music.

title: Studies in Language
description: Topics vary.

title: Stds Lang/Editing
description: Studies in specialized topics about the English language or editing. Topics vary.

title: Studies in Linguistics
description: Studies in specialized topics within Linguistics.

title: Studies in Lit Crit and Theory
description: Focused study of the history of theory and criticism or of current theoretical and conceptual approaches to literature.

title: Studies in Lit Form and Genre
description: Study of the codes, conventions, contexts, and development of a particular generic type.

title: Genre Studies
description: Various genres (e.g., novel, epic, tragedy) and problems of genre. Topics vary.

title: Genre Studies
description: Various genres (e.g., novel, epic, tragedy, lyric) and problems of genre. Topics vary.

title: Literary Relations
description: Interrelations of national literatures and figures and of literature with other areas of knowledge (art, history, law, psychology, music , etc.). Topics vary.

title: Literary Relations
description: Interrelations of national literatures and figures and of literature with other areas of knowledge (art, history, law, psychology, music, etc.). Topics vary.

title: Literary Theory
description: Topics vary.

title: Literary Theory
description: Critical theories of literature and literary analysis. Topics vary.

title: Studies in Literary Theory
description: In-depth study of primary texts by contemporary literary theorists (e.g., Barthes, Genette, structuralism, etc.). Language of instruction is English.

title: Studies in Literature
description: This course will examine works of Italian literature from all genres according to theme.

title: Studies in Literature
description: Intensive examination of topics in literature.  Presumes foundational knowledge in literary theory, criticism, and analysis.

title: Studies in Literature
description: Introduction to various literary themes, forms, and/or authors.

title: Studies in Literature
description: Topics vary.

title: Studies in Medieval Art
description: Selected topics in early Christian, Byzantine, Romanesque, and Gothic art.

title: Studies in Medieval Philosophy
description: Selected figures or topics.

description: Selected topics in modern and contemporary art of Europe and America.

title: Studies in Mdrn Nr Estrn Lang
description: Grammar, reading, writing, and conversational skills.

description: Selected figures or topics.

description: Graduate level course on Non Western Art

description: Various periods and movements (e.g., medieval, classicism, romanticism) or themes (e.g., Arthur, Faust).  Topics vary.
